subject: Veeam R&D Forums Digest for afshinmbi [Sep 20 - Sep 26, 2021]
full_text: Veeam R&D Forums Digest  September 20 - September 26, 2021       THE WORD FROM GOSTEV    We've just completedall the work on our 11a platform update and are planning to start its EarlyAvailability phase this week. Usually at this stage we used to distributethe bits through our Customer Support, however we were never happy with thenumber of downloads this approach yielded. As a result, this time we'regoing to try something new – to share download links publicly on the R&DForums. So, if you'd like to be an early adopter, keep an eye on therespective products' forums for the bits! As a reminder, this release ismostly about new platforms and new platform versions support. But there'salso a few new features and lots of smaller enhancements and bug fixes peryour feedback on V11. The KB article will contain the full release notes soI will not waste space with details here.  VMware vSphere Users: just to ensure this did not fly under anyone's radarlast week, you have some urgent vCenter Server patching to do regardless ofwhat vSphere version you are running due to a number of criticalvulnerabilities which are already being exploited in the wild. Here's agreat FAQ from VMware on this > VMSA-2021-0020: Questions & Answers  Continuing on the vSphere topic, I wanted to discuss full VM restoreperformance next. Fairly often we have customers opening support casesbecause they expected extremely fast restore performance with their newlyacquired super-duper SAN but are not getting good numbers. It is especiallyshocking and frustrating to those who have bought an all-flash array (AFA)and expected everything to start flying, which it did not. So what exactlyis causing this problem? Almost all VMs are thin provisioned these days, sowhen we write to a disk during restore, ESXi has to write zeros before itcould write our data. Most modern SAN include hardware acceleration (akaVAAI) for zeroing out disk regions, which greatly reduces the time andnetwork load when creating VMs and formatting VMDKs. It also helps restoreperformance when you are bandwidth or IOPS limited, as without it ESXi hasto write zeros the traditional way, which effectively doubles the amount ofwrites. However, this capability relies on hardware WRITE_SAME command,which is a serialized command meaning most drives/controllers block allother IO during this call, in turn causing some of these systems to belocked at a specific speed.  In fact, it's very similar to the behavior of TRIM: if you issue a massiveTRIM command it's like the entire drive will stop to perform and all otherI/O just waits.  Similarly, the controller has to complete the WRITE_SAMEcommand before it can go back to handling I/O. Now, because image-basedrestores are done "per-block", that zeroing out adds a good bit of latencyto each request. While it's probably just a few milliseconds, at 1MB blockseven 1ms latency limits us to only 1000 writes per second, or a theoreticalmaximum of 1000 MB/s. And with 2-3ms, you go down to 500MB/s or 333MB/srespectively. But when writing to super-fast storage like AFA that haswrite response times in microseconds, adding milliseconds of latency toeach request really impacts the raw performance these systems are capableof delivering. However, the good news is that this feature can be disabledduring run time, so we just recommend such customers to turn it off beforerestore and then back on. Here's the VMware KB article on how to do this > Disabling Hardware Accelerated Init (WRITESAME) in ESXi  Last topic for today is on the opposite side of enterprise backup storagespectrum: rotated drives! However, this can affect anyone in their"consumer" life too so don't be quick to frown, especially because it is avery counter-intuitive topic! What are the first things that come to yourmind when thinking about using SSD drives as a backup media? Based on thecommon sense alone, most will probably think the following: - SSDs don't like write cycles but these will be rare because they willspend most of the time in storage – meaning backup is an ideal workload forthem! - SSDs are a way better rotated backup media because there have nomechanical parts, meaning they will withstand vibration or accidentaldrops. Not to mention SSDs are so much more convenient to take along withyou off-site because they are so small and light. You can slip a few SSDsjust about anywhere and hardly even notice having them... but you can't saythe same about even a single HDD!  But it turns out that while all of those statements are correct, overallsituation is not so bright for SSDs due to some of their otherpeculiarities: - Unlike HDDs, powered off SSDs are just bad at retaining data, making themthe worst candidate as a long-term backup archival media. Simply put, SSDsare designed to be powered on most of the time! - While mechanically infinitely more reliable, travelling SSDs are in fargreater risk than travelling HDDs because you can lose your backups byaccidentally leaving SSD in a car over a hot summer weekend!  As you can see, while there's use for cheap SSDs as rotated backup media,it is fairly limited. It should serve you well if you do rotate and rewriteeach SSD with new backups every few months, while storing them in a "cooldry place" for the rest of the time (a safe should be perfect). But younever want to use SSDs for storing your yearly backups, or as an off-sitebackup media in warmer climates. And considering they still cost a fewtimes more per TB these days, I personally would think twice before goingthis route.       BEST POST OF THE WEEK    Re:Phasing Out our Socket-based Licensing [BY: Gostev • LIKED: 5times] OK so it's been almost half a yearsince my original newsletter so I thought I provide an update on thecurrent status.  All in all, it is looking like Veeam will in the end go ahead and stopselling Socket-based licenses sometime next year, just as I expected. Thismakes sense from the business perspective as these licenses cannot be usedfor the majority of workloads Veeam can protect these days. Since I likeanalogies: there's no point to keep selling gas that allows cars to driveon certain types of roads only.  Having said that, you still have theoption to keep your existing Socket licenses.  The exact cut-off date is still to be defined, but as always we will makethe announcement well in advance (in the coming weeks), so everyone whoneeds to stock up with more Sockets while they are still available willhave plenty of time and the opportunity to use either 2021 or 2022budget.  Considering all feedback received in this topic so far, here's what we'reinclined to do as a part of this transition:  1. We will allow existing customers to stay with Socket-based licenses theyalready own if this is what they prefer, and keep renewing Socketsmaintenance. In other words, from technical perspective we have no plans todiscontinue Socket license support in future product versions.  2. No customer will be forced to migrate from Sockets to VUL. The upgradesto VUL will be driven using "carrot" (incentives) versus "stick" (end oflife) approach. The Pricing team will continue to tweak the migrationpolicy by learning from your feedback on previous offers.  3. We will keep VUL available on both Subscription and Perpetual contracts,because in some markets customers only have the option to purchase onperpetual contracts.  Any comments or thoughts? Are there any unaddressed concerns we havemissed, FAQs we have to cover, etc.  Appreciate your feedback!      TOP CONTENT    Automaticallyadd new Hyper-V host to VEEAM [VIEWS: 220 • REPLIES: 10] Hi, We're trying to automate the deployment for Hyper-V as muchas possible. We now have one last manual step where VEEAM sees the new hostin SCVMM and we need to configure the host to be used by VEEAM. Is there away to automate this last step? And would it be best to do this byinstalling an MSI on the host and connecting to VEEAM, or maybe usepowershell to talk to the VEEAM Server and force installation? more vCenter7.0.2.00400 / 500 [VIEWS: 218 • REPLIES: 4] Hi Guys, For security reason vMware has released a new patchvCenter 7.0.2.00400 / 500. i was curious if VEEAM support thoseversion. more Is it possible toadd more services to one Alarm on an easy way. [VIEWS: 199 • REPLIES:9] Hi , When i choose an VM , and the switch toServices i see all Services from this Windows VM . Now i can chooseone Service and can with right Mouse configure an Alarm , but only for thisService . more Migrate to aanother object storage repo [VIEWS: 180 • REPLIES: 9] Hi there, we have some Azure Blob Container which we use toextend our vbo365 repos with. I want to migrate one of those repos. more VBO serverplacement [VIEWS: 180 • REPLIES: 12] Hello, I have customer who need to backup his O365. I neverdid it but it doesn't appear to be so complicated. I would like to knowwhat is the best practice about placement. Is it better to install it onthe VBR server or better to create new VM and dedicate it to VBO ? more       YOUR CONTENT    None of topics youhave contributed to have been updated this week.        UNSUBSCRIBEOR UPDATE MY E-MAIL PREFERENCES   WEEKLY VEEAM R&D FORUMS DIGEST

full_text: email_6041567cb039ff12       From: email_53c969ec0ec5f61f [mailto:email_53c969ec0ec5f61f] Sent: Monday, September 13, 2021 7:52 AMTo: Кирилл Репин Cc: Ansari Subject: IMSS Dear Mr.Repin, hello!In response to mentioned items in our previous emails, it is necessary to note the following items:   1. BNPP accepts the provided order for switching the language interface of IMSS software.   2. About the new revision of IMSS documents, it is necessary to inform you that:        A) A new revision of two documents (ДАШР.421457.001 МЧ and ДАШР.421457.001 Э5) is accepted.       B) In the figures of the ДАШР.302542.005 МЧ, the location of the created holes in middle section of MM needs to reviews again. In this regard and for more clarification, please find enclosed attached picture that shows the correct location of the upper created holes in MM.       C) By considering the previous item (1.B: as-built location of the created holes in the middle section of MM), it is necessary to provide a new revision of strength calculation document ( ). Please do not hesitate to inform us if you have any questions.With best regards, M.M.ErtejaeiDear Mr. Ertejaei, hello!  Hope your doing is well.  In attachment you can find corrected versions of documents ДАШР.302542.005 МЧ and ДАШР.421457.001 РР2 for BNPP considering. Please let me know if this documents are OK now and we will prepare signed copies for sending to you.  Thank you in advance!  With best regards, Kirill Repin Project manager Control Systems and Technological Equipment Division JSC "Diakont" Tel: +7(812)334-00-81 add.3105 E-mail: email_6041567cb039ff12        From: email_53c969ec0ec5f61f [mailto:email_53c969ec0ec5f61f] Sent: Monday, September 13, 2021 7:52 AM To: Кирилл Репин <email_6041567cb039ff12> Cc: Ansari <email_14600e8ed3c13e0a> Subject: IMSS  Dear Mr.Repin, hello! About the new revision of IMSS documents, it is necessary to inform you that: A) A new revision of two documents (ДАШР.421457.001 МЧ and ДАШР.421457.001 Э5) is accepted. B) In the figures of the ДАШР.302542.005 МЧ, the location of the created holes in middle section of MM needs to reviews again. In this regard and for more clarification, please find enclosed attached picture  that shows the correct location of the upper created holes in MM. C) By considering the previous item (1.B: as-built location of the created holes in the middle section of MM), it is necessary to provide a new revision of strength calculation document (  ). subject: Request 2021-162 from Kozloduy NPP
full_text: Sent: Monday, September 27, 2021 11:43 AMTo: Афанаскин Юрий Александрович Subject: Запрос АЭС КозлодуйДобрый день, Юрий Александрович.АЭС Козлодуй обращается ВАО АЭС на получение информации обеспечения необходимых параметров климата в помещениях с технологическим и электронным оборудованием при работе приточных вентиляционных установок в летнем режиме. Подробная информация в вложеных файлов на русском и английском языках.С уважениемRangel TsvetkovWANO MC RepresentativeKozloduy NPP, Bulgariaphone: +359 9737 6489Mobile/Viber: +phone_no_2e2bd460af3030fa89E-mail: email_a191a2bf75967306 email_7e230eb33fef6e35     Dear Colleagues,  Kozloduy NPP is asking to share your positive experience in preparing cooling water for supply ventilation systems operated in summer conditions.  Detailed questions please find in attachment.  Your responses will be appreciated.  Best regards,  Afanaskin Iurii    Уважаемые  коллеги ,  АЭС Козлодуй просит поделиться положительным опытом подготовки охлаждающей воды для приточных вентиляционных установок в летнем режиме.  Конкретные вопросы в приложении к сообщению.  Ваши ответы будут приняты с благодарностью.  С уважением,  Афанаскин Юрий      From: Цветков Рангел (Tzvetkov Rangel) <email_a191a2bf75967306>  Sent: Monday, September 27, 2021 11:43 AM  To: Афанаскин Юрий Александрович <email_433dfcb3cfd510a4>  Subject: Запрос АЭС Козлодуй      Добрый день, Юрий Александрович.    АЭС Козлодуй обращается ВАО АЭС на получение информации обеспечения необходимых параметров климата в помещениях с технологическим и электронным оборудованием при работе приточных вентиляционных установок в летнем режиме . Подробная информация в вложеных файлов на русском и английском языках.    С уважением      Rangel Tsvetkov  WANO MC Representative  Kozloduy NPP, Bulgaria  phone: +359 9737 6489  Mobile/Viber: +phone_no_2e2bd460af3030fa89  E-mail: email_a191a2bf75967306   email_7e230eb33fef6e35

full_text: If you need access to the Nuclear Community site or have any questions, please contact email_13abebf7d2795191 .Meeting RecordingsMeeting recordings are available to view using the links and passwords below.Please do not share the videos outside of your organisation.Video LinkPasswordIncludesHU I-WG - Sept 2021 - Day 1 4ka9cdjnf3h!cao92*         Introduction (Paul Boucher, Bruce Power)*         Safety Message (Tsonka Grozdeva, WANO)*         Russian NPP Fleet: Personnel Performance - Observation, Trends and Perspective (Andrey Yuzhakov, VNIIAES)*         Operating Experience and Human Performance (Ron Baumer, Nawah)*         HU Support Session (Phillip Harris)HU I-WG - Sept 2021 - Day 2 3dsjg96nias4!htocOverview of Sub-group work:*         HU Reference Manual + Gap Analysis*         HU KPIs*         HU Training HU I-WG - Sept 2021 - Day 3 8dsjg94noas4!htos*         Overview of Organisational Culture Self-Assessment(Regina Scheer, Bon Sens)*         Safety Culture from a National perspective: A Focus on Sweden (Patrik Tern, OKG)*         Lessons learned Country-Specific Safety Culture Forum: Finland (Jukka Paivarinta, Fortum)*         Interactive Discussion: Cultural DifferenceHU I-WG - Sept 2021 - Day 4 5gg5sp!jg07flhtaq6*         Safety Message (Sandor Nagy, WANO)*         Human Performance within the Action for Excellence (AfE) Initiative*         Human & Organisational Performance (HOP) (Heather Zettel, Bruce Power)*         Closing Session (Kathryn Harrison, Bruce Power)ActionsDateActionResponsibilityStatus/DeadlineMar 2021Get a more detailed understanding of the HU gaps in your organisations - Address during next meeting to see how we can take action to close the gapsAll I-WGmembersIn progressMar 2021Cross check of HU self-assessment GL against the latest revision of PO&C to identify possible gaps to be addressed by IWG in the futureOutstandingMar 2021Get requests for HU related MSMs and bench-markings from the WANO regional centresAlex PolyakovCompleteSept 2021Review HU Support Session requests and submit support/advice to email_13abebf7d2795191 All I-WGmembers8 Oct 2021Sept 2021Prepare a presentation on 'Contemporary HU guidance and Nuclear Safety Culture' for the March 2022 virtual meeting.(Phillip Harris & Tsonka Grozdeva)HU TrainingSub-groupSept 2021Create an Index of presentations presented at HU I-WG meetings over the years.Milly Stone1 Dec 2021Sept 2021Alignment between the 3 sub-groups in principles, philosophies, practices, etc.Sub-groupLeadsSave the DateThe next HU I-WG virtual meeting will be held on Microsoft Teams from 1-3 March 2022 September 2021. Save the Date!If you would like to present at a future meeting, please contact email_13abebf7d2795191 .Global Nuclear Industry HR SymposiumWANO will be holding the first ever Global Nuclear Industry HR Symposium on Thursday 17th February 2022. The target audience for this event is worldwide nuclear HR Directors and senior HR managers.It will be an opportunity for HR directors to learn about Action for Excellence - an industry led initiative to collectively improve the safety and performance of nuclear power plants worldwide, by 2030. As these skilled HR professionals will be key in making Action for Excellence a success, for their organisation and the global nuclear industry.The Symposium will illustrate the importance of HR Directors involvement, which will be pivotal in the future resourcing of WANO, whilst maintaining the opportunity to continually develop the knowledge, experience and skills of plant employees to help drive plant performance, and the industry worldwide.We will send you further information about the topics, speakers, and the agenda for the event soon.Any ideas for the HR Symposium agenda should be sent to email_af98fa5260ffbbdf .[YouTube] [Website] [LinkedIn] [Facebook] [Twitter] Copyright (c) 2021 World Association Nuclear Operators, All rights reserved.You are receiving this email because you are a member of the Human Performance I-WG. Save the Date!    If you would like to present at a future meeting, please contact email_13abebf7d2795191 .         Global Nuclear Industry HR Symposium  WANO will be holding the first ever Global Nuclear Industry HR Symposium on Thursday 17th February 2022. The target audience for this event is worldwide nuclear HR Directors and senior HR managers.  It will be an opportunity for HR directors to learn about Action for Excellence - an industry led initiative to collectively improve the safety and performance of nuclear power plants worldwide, by 2030. As these skilled HR professionals will be key in making Action for Excellence a success, for their organisation and the global nuclear industry.  The Symposium will illustrate the importance of HR Directors involvement, which will be pivotal in the future resourcing of WANO, whilst maintaining the opportunity to continually develop the knowledge, experience and skills of plant employees to help drive plant performance, and the industry worldwide.  We will send you further information about the topics, speakers, and the agenda for the event soon.    Any ideas for the HR Symposium agenda should be sent to email_af98fa5260ffbbdf .                      Copyright © 2021 World Association Nuclear Operators, All rights reserved. Kindly procced with the submission. I suggest using InTouch+ platform as it is the most efficient and reliable way.Looking forward to your nominations.Best regards,Mr Nikita Butakov |Associate Project Officer / JPO|Division for Europe| Department of Technical Cooperation |International Atomic Energy Agency | Vienna International Centre, PO Box 100, 1400 Vienna, Austria |Email: N.Bemail_21b92125f21e26e2 | T: (+43-1) 2600-21058 | B1062Follow us on www.iaea.org [cid:email_d463c67ed0fdbb8d01D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_a2ccf36f8043b80901D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_6437131478bb644c01D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_bd626e57c6f153a601D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_780c1ea148115a4b01D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_10de76945f9220c401D7B3C3.A6C14E80] ATOMS FOR PEACE AND DEVELOPMENT[cid:email_af7dacc216d437d801D7B3C3.A6C14E80]From: BUTAKOV, NikitaSent: Monday, 13 September 2021 09:56Subject: /EVT2100867/ -> EVT2002789 F2F step, Interregional Training Course on Design Safety and Safety Assessment for Nuclear Power Plants, 16-18 November 2021Dear participants,For your kind reminder we are starting early preparations for F2F step of Interregional Training Course on Design Safety and Safety Assessment for Nuclear Power Plants. The dates are 16-18 November and the Event is to be held in Saint Petersburg, Russia.This is an unofficial reminder, the official announcement would be distributed via official channels and your NLOs.Please consider your attendance keeping in mind restrictive measures against COVID-19 such as a restrictions on entering the country, requirements on quarantine after coming from the Event, current situation in your home country etc.As for conditions in Russia, there would be following requirements:  *   To check in and board a flight, foreign nationals travelling to the airports of the Russian Federation, including passengers in transit via airports in the Russian Federation, should present a medical document (certificate) with a negative Covid-19 PCR test result in Russian or English; the test should have been taken no more than three calendar days (including the date of arrival) prior to arrival in the Russian Federation. The validity of the PCR test certificate is calculated starting from the date the biological material was collected. Passengers who cannot present a certificate will be denied carriage. If it is not possible to submit the medical certificate in Russian or in English.  *   On arrival, foreign citizens on arrival should present a medical document confirming negative COVID-19 PCR test result in English or in Russian taken within 72 hours prior to boarding.  *   To access the territory of the Rosatom Technical Academy, participants should also provide a negative PCR test result, taken within 72 hours prior to the start of training. If the term of the first test is valid, participants/experts do not need to take a second test. It is allowed to present a certificate of vaccination to the organizers of the event from the Russian side.  *   To board the plane on departure, participants/experts must also present a negative PCR test result.Taking into account all of the above, please kindly send your reply to this email with confirmation or refusal to attend the Event.The deadline is Wednesday, 23 September 2021.In case of positive response, please kindly attach a copy of your valid passport for international travel. Your passport details are required for arranging safe arrival and stay in Russia.The reply without attached passport would be considered as refusal of attendance.I will send instructions on further actions i.e. nominations submission, traveling arrangements, etc. after gathering the information about your availability.Thank you for your cooperation and best regards,Mr Nikita Butakov |Associate Project Officer / JPO|Division for Europe| Department of Technical Cooperation |International Atomic Energy Agency | Vienna International Centre, PO Box 100, 1400 Vienna, Austria |Email: N.Bemail_21b92125f21e26e2 | T: (+43-1) 2600-21058 | B1062Follow us on www.iaea.org [cid:email_d463c67ed0fdbb8d01D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_a2ccf36f8043b80901D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_6437131478bb644c01D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_bd626e57c6f153a601D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_780c1ea148115a4b01D7B3C3.A6C14E80] [cid:email_10de76945f9220c401D7B3C3.A6C14E80] ATOMS FOR PEACE AND DEVELOPMENT[cid:email_af7dacc216d437d801D7B3C3.A6C14E80]This email message is intended only for the use of the named recipient. Information contained in this email message and its attachments may be privileged, confidential and protected from disclosure. If you are not the intended recipient, please do not read, copy, use or disclose this communication to others. Also please notify the sender by replying to this message and then delete it from your system.    Dear participants,    For your kind reminder I am still expecting your nominations. I have reopened the event for submission.    It is already beyond our deadline, and there would be no more extensions .    I encourage you to spend some time to apply for the event, including those who presented their passport and expressed their will to attend F2F step.    You have 2 days in order to send your nominations. Also keep in mind that your nomination should be endorsed by your NLO. Sometimes it takes up to 3 days to have the endorsement.  So, last day to apply is 29 of September . 30 of September is final day to get the endorsement.    Also I have received several emails with the nominations from last year. For your kind information since the event was not only postponed but also the approach to the event was changed you have to reapply with new nomination and new endorsement. Nominations from last year are NOT considered by the system .    Also I would appreciate your reply on this email with confirmation of submission, so I could reach your NLO in case of any issues.    During the submission kindly check if your profile has valid passport for international travel . This information would be forwarded to the Russian Government in order to arrange your arrival without additional COVID restrictions.    Virtual participation is under revision, if it would become available I will distribute this information. Still in order to participate you have to submit your nomination.    Thank you and looking forward to your replies.    Best regards,      Mr Nikita Butakov |Associate Project Officer / JPO|   Division for Europe| Department of Technical Cooperation |   International Atomic Energy Agency | Vienna International Centre, PO Box 100, 1400 Vienna, Austria |   Email:  N.Bemail_21b92125f21e26e2 | T: (+43-1) 2600-21058 | B1062  Follow us on www.iaea.org            ATOMS FOR PEACE AND DEVELOPMENT        From: BUTAKOV, Nikita  Sent: Thursday, 23 September 2021 15:32  Subject: FW: /EVT2100867/ -> EVT2002789 F2F step, Interregional Training Course on Design Safety and Safety Assessment for Nuclear Power Plants, 16-18 November 2021      Dear participants,    For your kind information the F2F event EVT2002789 is already announced and open for the submission of nominations. Kindly procced with the submission. I suggest using InTouch+ platform as it is the most efficient and reliable way.    Looking forward to your nominations.    Best regards,      Mr Nikita Butakov |Associate Project Officer / JPO|   Division for Europe| Department of Technical Cooperation |   International Atomic Energy Agency | Vienna International Centre, PO Box 100, 1400 Vienna, Austria |   Email:  N.Bemail_21b92125f21e26e2 | T: (+43-1) 2600-21058 | B1062  Follow us on www.iaea.org            ATOMS FOR PEACE AND DEVELOPMENT        From: BUTAKOV, Nikita  Sent: Monday, 13 September 2021 09:56  Subject: /EVT2100867/ -> EVT2002789 F2F step, Interregional Training Course on Design Safety and Safety Assessment for Nuclear Power Plants, 16-18 November 2021      Dear participants,    For your kind reminder we are starting early preparations for F2F step  of Interregional Training Course on Design Safety and Safety Assessment for Nuclear Power Plants. The dates are 16-18 November and the Event is to be held in Saint Petersburg, Russia.    This is an unofficial reminder, the official announcement would be distributed via official channels and your NLOs.    Please consider your attendance keeping in mind restrictive measures against COVID-19 such as a restrictions on entering the country, requirements on quarantine after coming from the Event, current situation in your home country etc.    As for conditions in Russia, there would be following requirements:     To check in and board a flight, foreign nationals travelling to the airports of the Russian Federation, including passengers in transit via airports in the Russian Federation, should present a medical document (certificate) with a negative Covid-19 PCR test result in Russian or English; the test should have been taken no more than three calendar days (including the date of arrival) prior to arrival in the Russian Federation. The validity of the PCR test certificate is calculated starting from the date the biological material was collected. Passengers who cannot present a certificate will be denied carriage. If it is not possible to submit the medical certificate in Russian or in English.     On arrival, foreign citizens on arrival should present a medical document confirming negative COVID-19 PCR test result in English or in Russian taken within 72 hours prior to boarding.     To access the territory of the Rosatom Technical Academy, participants should also provide a negative PCR test result, taken within 72 hours prior to the start of training. If the term of the first test is valid, participants/experts do not need to take a second test. It is allowed to present a certificate of vaccination to the organizers of the event from the Russian side.     To board the plane on departure, participants/experts must also present a negative PCR test result.      Taking into account all of the above, please kindly send your reply to this email with confirmation or refusal to attend the Event.  The deadline is Wednesday, 23 September 2021.   In case of positive response, please kindly attach a copy of your valid passport for international travel. Your passport details are required for arranging safe arrival and stay in Russia.    The reply without  attached passport would be considered as refusal  of attendance.    I will send instructions on further actions i.e. nominations submission, traveling arrangements, etc. after gathering the information about your availability.    Thank you for your cooperation and best regards,       Mr Nikita Butakov |Associate Project Officer / JPO|   Division for Europe| Department of Technical Cooperation |   International Atomic Energy Agency | Vienna International Centre, PO Box 100, 1400 Vienna, Austria |   Email:  N.Bemail_21b92125f21e26e2 | T: (+43-1) 2600-21058 | B1062  Follow us on www.iaea.org            ATOMS FOR PEACE AND DEVELOPMENT       This email message is intended only for the use of the named recipient. subject:
RE: "WS on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models for
 Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and Challenges
 toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis"
full_text: | T: (+43-1) 2600-22064 | F: (+43-1) 2600-7 22064 |From: email_266a829fac2c1c40 Sent: Wednesday, 21 February 2018 16:41To: FUKUSHIMA, Yoshimitsu Subject: "WS on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis"Dear Yushi,I hope this e-mail finds you well in full of energy and health.Please be aware that NPPD introduces one of the best expert in Seismic issues for the "Second Workshop on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis" to be held in 14 to 16 May 2018 in France. The nominee is "Miss shaghayegh Ameli zamani" . You know her. She was involved as an qualified expert from Iranian side in IAEA mission, October 2016 in Tehran. We sent her Application Form as well as the request for GRANT through official channel to IAEA.Since the WS on "Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment" is along with direct and Complete issues of challenging affairs in providing seismic data, initial data of new units of Bushher nuclear power plant that you are aware of it, it is suggested that the seismology expert of NPPD,( Miss shaghayegh Ameli zamani), participates in this workshop.In the other hand, the subject of the mentioned workshop is utterly in line with her education and her job commitment and she can be efficient and useful in seismic hazard assessment complementary study in new units of Bushehr nuclear power plant and about which you are completely aware of besides, since ladies are in priority from IAEA ( based on the atomic energy agency laws) and NPPD points of view ,I highly appreciate you to take necessary measures in order to allocate the GRANT for her. It speeds up her presence in the meeting.I kindly ask you to inform me of the result.I appreciate you in advance for your consideration and cooperation.with best regards,Your Friend in NPPD, Tehran, IranAmirThis email message is intended only for the use of the named recipient. Information contained in this email message and its attachments may be privileged, confidential and protected from disclosure. If you are not the intended recipient, please do not read, copy, use or disclose this communication to others. Also please notify the sender by replying to this message and then delete it from your system.    Dear Amir, Salaam!    I miss you long time.  How are you doing?    I am involving a part of TC project design relevant to external events.  You want to have a workshop in terms of Deep Soil Mixing.     We IAEA can conduct the workshop only based on the IAEA safety standards. Specific companies, SOILMEC and TREVI are not our partners.  I would like to know more concrete ideas of your wishes and to seek availability of our side.    DSM will be in new sites and you already started to phase 2, so the workshop might be too late to conduct.  What do you expect?    Based on the IAEA safety standards, potential of massive liquefaction is recommended as exclusion criteria of siting.    Please give my best regards to my friends in Tehran.    I am looking forwards to hearing from you.    Khodahafez, Yushi.      Mr Yoshimitsu Fukushima | Senior Safety Officer | Dr.(Eng.)   External Events Safety Section | Division of Nuclear Installation Safety | Department of Nuclear Safety and Security |   International Atomic Energy Agency | Vienna International Centre, PO Box 100, 1400 Vienna, Austria  |   Email:  Y.Femail_88da8466c2f4da7b | T: (+43-1) 2600-22064 | F: (+43-1) 2600-7 22064 |            From: email_266a829fac2c1c40 <email_266a829fac2c1c40>  Sent: Wednesday, 21 February 2018 16:41  To: FUKUSHIMA, Yoshimitsu <Y.Femail_88da8466c2f4da7b>  Subject: "WS on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis"        Dear Yushi,       I hope this e-mail finds you well in full of energy and health.    Please be aware that NPPD introduces one of the best expert in Seismic issues for the "Second Workshop on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis" to be held in 14 to 16 May 2018 in France. The nominee is "Miss shaghayegh Ameli zamani" . You know her. She was involved as an qualified expert from Iranian side in IAEA mission, October 2016 in Tehran. We sent her Application Form as well as the request for GRANT through official channel to IAEA.          Since the WS on "Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment" is along with direct and Complete issues of challenging affairs in providing seismic data, initial data of new units of Bushher nuclear power plant that you are aware of it, it is suggested that the seismology expert of NPPD,( Miss shaghayegh Ameli zamani), participates in this workshop.     In the other hand, the subject of the mentioned workshop is utterly in line with her education and her job commitment and she can be efficient and useful in seismic hazard assessment complementary study in new units of Bushehr nuclear power plant and about which you are completely aware of besides, since ladies are in priority from IAEA ( based on the atomic energy agency laws) and NPPD points of view ,  I highly appreciate you to take necessary measures in order to allocate the GRANT for her. It speeds up her presence in the meeting.       I kindly ask you to inform me of the result.     I appreciate you in advance for your consideration and cooperation.       with best regards,     Your Friend in NPPD, Tehran, Iran       Amir        This email message is intended only for the use of the named recipient. subject: Training sub group of HuP Industrial working group
full_text: Join with a video conferencing deviceemail_0202f380245cb1c3 Video Conference ID: 129 858 505 6Alternate VTC instructions [https://privacy.wanopc.org/WANO-logo-landscape.png]You can also join this meeting from Polycom, Cisco, Lifesize meeting rooms and Zoom. For more information click on "Help".If you need assistance, you can contact WANOPC Helpdesk +phone_no_4c715d4e97bc512a0 or email_0b47971f5222e31e .Learn More | Help | Meeting options | Legal ________________________________________________________________________________    Dear All,  As our previous task for designing a Seminar programme for Managers on  “Enlightened view of Human and Organisational Performance” is already done (pilot session to be scheduled by WANO PC in 2022), it was proposed by the participants in the September HuP Industrial working group  meeting to continue to work as a subgroup for a new task:  Prepare a presentation on “Contemporary HU guidance and Nuclear Safety Culture” for the March 2022 virtual meeting.    The Leader for this work will be Phillip Harris, myself I will be the WANO facilitator. Your contribution is very welcome.  If you want to participate in this common work that will be submitted to the HuP Industrial working group, please join us.  The 26 th of October will be our first meeting, we plan to have 1 meeting per month till the next plenary session in March 2022.  Looking forward to hear your confirmation.  Kind regards  Tsonka      ____________________________________________________________________________     Microsoft Teams meeting      Join on your computer or mobile app    Click here to join the meeting     Join with a video conferencing device     email_0202f380245cb1c3     Video Conference ID: 129 858 505 6    Alternate VTC instructions        You can also join this meeting from Polycom, Cisco, Lifesize meeting rooms and Zoom. For more information click on "Help". If you need assistance, you can contact WANOPC Helpdesk +phone_no_4c715d4e97bc512a0 or email_0b47971f5222e31e . subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"
full_text: To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" , "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 7:22:29 PMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн, добрый день!Направляю распределение областей так, как я это вижу. Романов (ответственный от компании), Тарушко без корпоративного опыта и участвует первый раз. Предлагаю вам работать с Гаетаном в областях СО.1 и СО.2. На второй неделе отвлечешься на роль Советника Отрасли, то есть принять участие в разговорах с руководителями АТЭ.С уважением,Сергей Шишкин-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 4:01 PMTo: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear sergey,Given that the reviewers in Areas 1 and 2 are present, and given your experiences with the presence of an industry advisor, how effective and necessary do you think my presence will be from November 7th?Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Cc: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 3:59:10 PMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Извиняюсь, "Корпоративное лидерство" - это СО.1-----Original Message-----From: Фаллер Сергей ВикторовичSent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 3:27 PMTo: email_fb9dc050b654b8ca' Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн,я совсем не против, если ты направишь свой фокус на проверку "Корпоративного лидерства (СО.2)" или "Корпоративного руководства (СО.2)".В любом случае мы рассчитываем, что ты прилетишь 7-го ноября и примешь участие в КПП с самого начала.С уважением,Сергей Фаллер-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 1:52 PMTo: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey.It should also be noted that according to the TDMF form sent by WANO-Mc, I had announced my readiness to participate in areas 1 and 2. Maybe it would have been better if you had raised this issue with me.Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: email_a190cc98813c23dcTo: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Cc: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 1:54:56 PMSubject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey,In this case, I do not think my presence will be so beneficial for almost two weeks-as stated in WANO-MC letter, during all stage of CPR in Moscow. Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Cc: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 10:44:17 AMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн, здравствуй!Мы не стали назначать тебя ответственным за какую-либо область проверки, потому что на заключительном этапе КПП хотели бы возложить на тебя функции Отраслевого Советника.Всего наилучшего,Сергей Фаллер-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 10:03 AMTo: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey,I hope you are all well and healthy. would you please tell me in which area I will work in the CPR of the ATE?Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: email_a190cc98813c23dcTo: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Sent: Sunday, September 19, 2021 9:10:34 AMSubject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Serge,thank you.Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Sent: Thursday, September 16, 2021 3:57:04 PMSubject: FW: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн, добрый день!Во вложении - письмо МЦ, которое сегодня было направлено в NPPD.Best regards,Sergey FallerWANO MC, Peer Reviews – AdviserTel: phone_no_c35ff30ebd277313, ext.164Cell: phone_no_2813b3fe2c6e4c28E-mail: email_cf90a25c8e7998bd25 Ferganskaya, Moscow, 109507-----Original Message-----From: documents Sent: Thursday, September 16, 2021 2:13 PMTo: email_5a6c316153be0052; email_20ea1f06a3226d7e; Фаллер Сергей Викторович Subject: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Please read the attached document.Это сообщение автоматически сформировано системой электронного документооборота Если у Вас возникли вопросы, Вы сможете обратится поТел: +7 (495) 376-15-87Факс: +7 (495) 376-08-97E-mail: email_3d8693a16356cfc5infoС уважением,ВАО АЭС-МЦThis message is automatically generated by the electronic document management system If you have any questions, you can contactTel: +7 (495) 376-15-87Fax : +7 (495) 376-08-97E-mail: email_3d8693a16356cfc5infoSincerely,WANO-MC

In attachment you can find corrected versions of documents ДАШР.302542.005 МЧ and ДАШР.421457.001 РР2 for BNPP considering. Please let me know if this documents are OK now and we will prepare signed copies for sending to you. Thank you in advance! With best regards, Kirill Repin Project manager Control Systems and Technological Equipment Division JSC "Diakont" Tel: +7(812)334-00-81 add.3105 E-mail: email_6041567cb039ff12 From: email_53c969ec0ec5f61f [mailto:email_53c969ec0ec5f61f] Sent: Monday, September 13, 2021 7:52 AM To: Кирилл Репин Cc: Ansari Subject: IMSS Dear Mr.Repin, hello! About the new revision of IMSS documents, it is necessary to inform you that: A) A new revision of two documents (ДАШР.421457.001 МЧ and ДАШР.421457.001 Э5) is accepted. C) By considering the previous item (1.B: as-built location of the created holes in the middle section of MM), it is necessary to provide a new revision of strength calculation document ( ). Please do not hesitate to inform us if you have any questions. subject: Re: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna
full_text: به: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e فرستاده شد: یک شنبه 4 مهر 1400, 11:59:42 ب.ظ عنوان: RE: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna Dear Kheirollahi, For communication, can you use Zoom ? Regarding IP, I have no idea how to use IP for communication. In your site, three entities ( NPPD, OCE and Site) will join. In our site, we also have three entities ( Vienna, Seoul and Daejon). Can you explain how IP can communicate with your colleagues ? Regards Ki Sig KANG From: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e Sent: Sunday, September 19, 2021 8:58 AM To: KiSig Kang Cc: email_266a829fac2c1c40 ; peyman Toorafshan ; derakhshandeh Subject: Re: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna Hello Mr. Kang While respecting and thanking you, regarding the use of webex for online communication, unfortunately Iran is a sanction in this regard and we only need to determine an IP by you and we can communicate with you via video conference. In case of communication, this communication will be tripartite between you, Tehran (NPPD, consultant and technical support company) and Bushehr site (operation company), a total of 4-5 specialists and a translator in Bushehr, which of course in Tehran, if necessary. We will use a translator. After introducing the participants, a presentation regarding the status of CM in Bushehr will be presented by the expert of the operation company. In the continuation of the meeting, we will use your guidance regarding the general favorable situation of CM in a nuclear power plant in South Korea. If you agree, we will pursue the main strategy of examining the issue using distance analysis to achieve the goal. The above items are completely consistent with the items mentioned in your submitted file, and we will achieve the desired results. I will review the submission of photos and brief records of the experts participating in the meeting. Sincerely KHEIROLLAHI NPPD Expert ... از: "KiSig Kang" < kiSigKemail_cc6b75f395a5d224 > به: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e رونوشت: email_266a829fac2c1c40 , "peyman Toorafshan" < email_dae462ea4a069c3e >, "derakhshandeh" < email_a190cc98813c23dc > فرستاده شد: پنج شنبه 25 شهریور 1400, 8:12:55 ق.ظ عنوان: RE: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna Dear Kheirolahi, Thanks for your understanding. Even COVID-19 situation, people want to visit their home towns. We will use Webex for on-line meeting. The on-line meeting will be held at 10:00 on 29 September ( Tehran time). To make more productive results, I have a few questions as follow;     * Do you hire an interpreter for simultaneous translation ? ( We will use English)     * How many people will join the meeting ? In case of Korea side, five or six people will join the meeting.     * Can I ask you your interesting points or issues on CM to be solved     * Can you prepare your participant introduction slides ? ( see attached file)     * Let me know the e-mail list for invitation. Thanks for your interesting. Regards Ki Sig Kang, Ph.D, P.E. Senior Specialist Plant Engineering & Infrastructure Vienna, AustriaHello Mr. Kang Thank you for your attention, based on coordination with NPPD computer experts, unfortunately, it is not possible to connect from Iran using ZOOM. At the same time, for connecting via IP video conferencing, if you ask computer experts, they probably have the experience of connecting this way, such as in the context of sysco or POLYCOM or any other video conferencing hardware, allowing ip and connection of all parties to it. has it. Yours sincerely KHEIROLLAHI از: "KiSig Kang" <kiSigKemail_cc6b75f395a5d224> به: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e فرستاده شد: یک شنبه 4 مهر 1400,  11:59:42 ب.ظ عنوان: RE: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna    Dear Kheirollahi,    For communication, can you use Zoom ? subject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"
full_text: Sent: Tuesday, September 28, 2021 8:54 AMTo: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Cc: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey,I am sorry for the delay in responding to your email. There was a problem with my email yesterday that I could read the emails but had trouble replying.I agree with your proposal. This means that the first week we will go to Novovoronezh and work with Gaetan for reviewing CO.1,2.Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" , "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 7:22:29 PMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн, добрый день!Направляю распределение областей так, как я это вижу. Романов (ответственный от компании), Тарушко без корпоративного опыта и участвует первый раз. Предлагаю вам работать с Гаетаном в областях СО.1 и СО.2. На второй неделе отвлечешься на роль Советника Отрасли, то есть принять участие в разговорах с руководителями АТЭ.С уважением,Сергей Шишкин-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 4:01 PMTo: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear sergey,Given that the reviewers in Areas 1 and 2 are present, and given your experiences with the presence of an industry advisor, how effective and necessary do you think my presence will be from November 7th?Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Cc: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 3:59:10 PMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Извиняюсь, "Корпоративное лидерство" - это СО.1-----Original Message-----From: Фаллер Сергей ВикторовичSent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 3:27 PMTo: email_fb9dc050b654b8ca' Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн,я совсем не против, если ты направишь свой фокус на проверку "Корпоративного лидерства (СО.2)" или "Корпоративного руководства (СО.2)".В любом случае мы рассчитываем, что ты прилетишь 7-го ноября и примешь участие в КПП с самого начала.С уважением,Сергей Фаллер-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 1:52 PMTo: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey.It should also be noted that according to the TDMF form sent by WANO-Mc, I had announced my readiness to participate in areas 1 and 2. Maybe it would have been better if you had raised this issue with me.Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: email_a190cc98813c23dcTo: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Cc: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 1:54:56 PMSubject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey,In this case, I do not think my presence will be so beneficial for almost two weeks-as stated in WANO-MC letter, during all stage of CPR in Moscow. Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Cc: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 10:44:17 AMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн, здравствуй!Мы не стали назначать тебя ответственным за какую-либо область проверки, потому что на заключительном этапе КПП хотели бы возложить на тебя функции Отраслевого Советника.Всего наилучшего,Сергей Фаллер-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 10:03 AMTo: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey,I hope you are all well and healthy. would you please tell me in which area I will work in the CPR of the ATE?Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: email_a190cc98813c23dcTo: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Sent: Sunday, September 19, 2021 9:10:34 AMSubject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Serge,thank you.Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Sent: Thursday, September 16, 2021 3:57:04 PMSubject: FW: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн, добрый день!Во вложении - письмо МЦ, которое сегодня было направлено в NPPD.Best regards,Sergey FallerWANO MC, Peer Reviews – AdviserTel: phone_no_c35ff30ebd277313, ext.164Cell: phone_no_2813b3fe2c6e4c28E-mail: email_cf90a25c8e7998bd25 Ferganskaya, Moscow, 109507-----Original Message-----From: documents Sent: Thursday, September 16, 2021 2:13 PMTo: email_5a6c316153be0052; email_20ea1f06a3226d7e; Фаллер Сергей Викторович Subject: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Please read the attached document.Это сообщение автоматически сформировано системой электронного документооборота Если у Вас возникли вопросы, Вы сможете обратится поТел: +7 (495) 376-15-87Факс: +7 (495) 376-08-97E-mail: email_3d8693a16356cfc5infoС уважением,ВАО АЭС-МЦThis message is automatically generated by the electronic document management system If you have any questions, you can contactTel: +7 (495) 376-15-87Fax : +7 (495) 376-08-97E-mail: email_3d8693a16356cfc5infoSincerely,WANO-MC

subject: RE: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna
full_text: Sent: Tuesday, September 28, 2021 8:59 AMTo: KiSig Kang Cc: derakhshandeh ; peyman Toorafshan ; rahnama Subject: Re: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at ViennaHello Mr. KangThank you for your attention, based on coordination with NPPD computer experts, unfortunately, it is not possible to connect from Iran using ZOOM. At the same time, for connecting via IP video conferencing, if you ask computer experts, they probably have the experience of connecting this way, such as in the context of sysco or POLYCOM or any other video conferencing hardware, allowing ip and connection of all parties to it. has it.Yours sincerelyKHEIROLLAHIاز: "KiSig Kang" به: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7eفرستاده شد: یک شنبه 4 مهر 1400,  11:59:42 ب.ظعنوان: RE: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at ViennaDear Kheirollahi,For communication, can you use Zoom ?Regarding IP, I have no idea how to use IP for communication.In your site, three entities ( NPPD, OCE and Site) will join. In our site, we also have three entities ( Vienna, Seoul and Daejon). Can you explain how IP can communicate with your colleagues ?RegardsKi Sig KANGFrom: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e Sent: Sunday, September 19, 2021 8:58 AMTo: KiSig Kang Cc: email_266a829fac2c1c40 ; peyman Toorafshan ; derakhshandeh Subject: Re: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at ViennaHello Mr. KangWhile respecting and thanking you, regarding the use of webex for online communication, unfortunately Iran is a sanction in this regard and we only need to determine an IP by you and we can communicate with you via video conference.In case of communication, this communication will be tripartite between you, Tehran (NPPD, consultant and technical support company) and Bushehr site (operation company), a total of 4-5 specialists and a translator in Bushehr, which of course in Tehran, if necessary. We will use a translator.After introducing the participants, a presentation regarding the status of CM in Bushehr will be presented by the expert of the operation company.In the continuation of the meeting, we will use your guidance regarding the general favorable situation of CM in a nuclear power plant in South Korea.If you agree, we will pursue the main strategy of examining the issue using distance analysis to achieve the goal.The above items are completely consistent with the items mentioned in your submitted file, and we will achieve the desired results.I will review the submission of photos and brief records of the experts participating in the meeting.SincerelyKHEIROLLAHINPPD Expert ...از: "KiSig Kang" >به: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e رونوشت: email_266a829fac2c1c40 , "peyman Toorafshan" >, "derakhshandeh" >فرستاده شد: پنج شنبه 25 شهریور 1400,  8:12:55 ق.ظعنوان: RE: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at ViennaDear Kheirolahi,Thanks for your understanding.Even COVID-19 situation, people want to visit their home towns.We will use Webex for on-line meeting. The on-line meeting will be held at 10:00 on 29 September ( Tehran time).To make more productive results, I have  a few questions as follow;  *   Do you hire an interpreter for simultaneous translation ?  ( We will use English)  *   How many people will join the meeting ? In case of Korea side, five or six people will join the meeting.  *   Can I ask you your interesting points or issues on CM to be solved  *   Can you prepare your participant introduction slides ? ( see attached file)  *   Let me know the e-mail list for invitation.Thanks for your interesting.RegardsKi Sig Kang, Ph.D, P.E.Senior SpecialistPlant Engineering & InfrastructureVienna, Austria    Dear Kheirollahi,    I will ask your reply to IT expert.  Just wait a little.    Regards    Ki Sig KANG    From: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e  Sent: Tuesday, September 28, 2021 8:59 AM  To: KiSig Kang  Cc: derakhshandeh ; peyman Toorafshan ; rahnama  Subject: Re: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna           Hello Mr. Kang   Thank you for your attention, based on coordination with NPPD computer experts, unfortunately, it is not possible to connect from Iran using ZOOM. At the same time, for connecting via IP video conferencing, if you ask computer experts, they probably have the experience of connecting this way, such as in the context of sysco or POLYCOM or any other video conferencing hardware, allowing ip and connection of all parties to it. has it.   Yours sincerely  KHEIROLLAHI     از: "KiSig Kang" <kiSigKemail_cc6b75f395a5d224>  به: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e  فرستاده شد: یک شنبه 4 مهر 1400,  11:59:42 ب.ظ  عنوان: RE: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna      Dear Kheirollahi,    For communication, can you use Zoom ?  Regarding IP, I have no idea how to use IP for communication.    In your site, three entities ( NPPD, OCE and Site) will join. In our site, we also have three entities ( Vienna, Seoul and Daejon). Can you explain how IP can communicate with your colleagues ?    Regards    Ki Sig KANG      From: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e  Sent: Sunday, September 19, 2021 8:58 AM  To: KiSig Kang  Cc: email_266a829fac2c1c40 ; peyman Toorafshan ; derakhshandeh  Subject: Re: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna           Hello Mr. Kang    While respecting and thanking you, regarding the use of webex for online communication, unfortunately Iran is a sanction in this regard and we only need to determine an IP by you and we can communicate with you via video conference.    In case of communication, this communication will be tripartite between you, Tehran (NPPD, consultant and technical support company) and Bushehr site (operation company), a total of 4-5 specialists and a translator in Bushehr, which of course in Tehran, if necessary. We will use a translator.    After introducing the participants, a presentation regarding the status of CM in Bushehr will be presented by the expert of the operation company.    In the continuation of the meeting, we will use your guidance regarding the general favorable situation of CM in a nuclear power plant in South Korea. If you agree, we will pursue the main strategy of examining the issue using distance analysis to achieve the goal.    The above items are completely consistent with the items mentioned in your submitted file, and we will achieve the desired results. I will review the submission of photos and brief records of the experts participating in the meeting.  Sincerely KHEIROLLAHI  NPPD Expert ...     از: "KiSig Kang" < kiSigKemail_cc6b75f395a5d224 >  به: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e  رونوشت: email_266a829fac2c1c40 , "peyman Toorafshan" < email_dae462ea4a069c3e >, "derakhshandeh" < email_a190cc98813c23dc >  فرستاده شد: پنج شنبه 25 شهریور 1400,  8:12:55 ق.ظ  عنوان: RE: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna         Dear Kheirolahi,    Thanks for your understanding.  Even COVID-19 situation, people want to visit their home towns.  We will use Webex for on-line meeting. The on-line meeting will be held at 10:00 on 29 September ( Tehran time).  To make more productive results, I have  a few questions as follow;    Do you hire an interpreter for simultaneous translation ?  ( We will use English)  How many people will join the meeting ? In case of Korea side, five or six people will join the meeting.  Can I ask you your interesting points or issues on CM to be solved  Can you prepare your participant introduction slides ? ( see attached file)    Let me know the e-mail list for invitation.    Thanks for your interesting.    Regards      Ki Sig Kang, Ph.D, P.E.    Senior Specialist  Plant Engineering & Infrastructure  Vienna, Austria

subject:
Re: "WS on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models
 for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and
 Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis"
full_text: To: email_266a829fac2c1c40 Sent: Monday, September 27, 2021 7:14:49 PM Subject: RE: "WS on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis" Dear Amir, Salaam! I miss you long time. How are you doing? I am involving a part of TC project design relevant to external events. You want to have a workshop in terms of Deep Soil Mixing. We IAEA can conduct the workshop only based on the IAEA safety standards. Specific companies, SOILMEC and TREVI are not our partners. I would like to know more concrete ideas of your wishes and to seek availability of our side. DSM will be in new sites and you already started to phase 2, so the workshop might be too late to conduct. What do you expect? Based on the IAEA safety standards, potential of massive liquefaction is recommended as exclusion criteria of siting. Please give my best regards to my friends in Tehran. I am looking forwards to hearing from you. Khodahafez, Yushi. Mr Yoshimitsu Fukushima | Senior Safety Officer | Dr.(Eng.) External Events Safety Section | Division of Nuclear Installation Safety | Department of Nuclear Safety and Security | International Atomic Energy Agency | Vienna International Centre, PO Box 100, 1400 Vienna, Austria | Email: Y.Femail_88da8466c2f4da7b | T: (+43-1) 2600-22064 | F: (+43-1) 2600-7 22064 | From: email_266a829fac2c1c40 Sent: Wednesday, 21 February 2018 16:41 To: FUKUSHIMA, Yoshimitsu Subject: "WS on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis" Dear Yushi, I hope this e-mail finds you well in full of energy and health. Please be aware that NPPD introduces one of the best expert in Seismic issues for the "Second Workshop on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis" to be held in 14 to 16 May 2018 in France. The nominee is "Miss shaghayegh Ameli zamani" . You know her. She was involved as an qualified expert from Iranian side in IAEA mission, October 2016 in Tehran. We sent her Application Form as well as the request for GRANT through official channel to IAEA. Since the WS on "Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment" is along with direct and Complete issues of challenging affairs in providing seismic data, initial data of new units of Bushher nuclear power plant that you are aware of it, it is suggested that the seismology expert of NPPD,( Miss shaghayegh Ameli zamani), participates in this workshop. In the other hand, the subject of the mentioned workshop is utterly in line with her education and her job commitment and she can be efficient and useful in seismic hazard assessment complementary study in new units of Bushehr nuclear power plant and about which you are completely aware of besides, since ladies are in priority from IAEA ( based on the atomic energy agency laws) and NPPD points of view , I highly appreciate you to take necessary measures in order to allocate the GRANT for her. It speeds up her presence in the meeting. I kindly ask you to inform me of the result. I appreciate you in advance for your consideration and cooperation. with best regards, Your Friend in NPPD, Tehran, Iran Amir This email message is intended only for the use of the named recipient. I would like to know more concrete ideas of your wishes and to seek availability of our side. Since the WS on "Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment" is along with direct and Complete issues of challenging affairs in providing seismic data, initial data of new units of Bushher nuclear power plant that you are aware of it, it is suggested that the seismology expert of NPPD,( Miss shaghayegh Ameli zamani), participates in this workshop. In the other hand, the subject of the mentioned workshop is utterly in line with her education and her job commitment and she can be efficient and useful in seismic hazard assessment complementary study in new units of Bushehr nuclear power plant and about which you are completely aware of besides, since ladies are in priority from IAEA ( based on the atomic energy agency laws) and NPPD points of view , I highly appreciate you to take necessary measures in order to allocate the GRANT for her. It speeds up her presence in the meeting. I kindly ask you to inform me of the result. I appreciate you in advance for your consideration and cooperation. with best regards, Your Friend in NPPD, Tehran, Iran Amir This email message is intended only for the use of the named recipient. If you have any issues accessing the site, please do let us know.Course: 04-08 October, 2021 Virtual Regional Training Course on the Preparation, Conduct, and Evaluation of Emergency Exercises to Test Preparedness and Response for a Nuclear or Radiological Emergency (iaea.org) Enrolment Key: PCEeetpRNRE4  (Case Sensitive)WebEx Training:This workshop is a virtual event conducted by means of WebEx Training. Information contained in this email message and its attachments may be privileged, confidential and protected from disclosure. If you are not the intended recipient, please do not read, copy, use or disclose this communication to others. Also please notify the sender by replying to this message and then delete it from your system.    Dear Participants,    My name is Muzna Assi and I am an Emergency Preparedness Officer in the IAEA Incident and Emergency Centre (IEC). I am the technical officer of the TC project RAS 9089 and will be supporting you during this virtual training course along with my colleague Ms Stacey Horvitz (an associate Emergency Preparedness Officer in the IEC).    Please read this email carefully, as it contains essential information for your successful participation in the upcoming event.    I would like to welcome you all to our upcoming event titled “Virtual Regional Training Course on the Preparation, Conduct, and Evaluation of Emergency Exercises to Test Preparedness and Response for a Nuclear or Radiological Emergency” that will take place virtually from 04 to 08 October 2021 , and brief you on some important issues and preparations related to your participation.    Workshop Material on CLP4NET:    We have developed an online platform to supplement the meeting. The CLP4NET (Cyber Learning Platform for Network Education and Training) is an online platform that allows users to find educational resources easily and contains a learning environment to support instructor-led courses and share e-learning self-study resources.    Information in relating to the meeting will be stored and uploaded the online platform for this event. Please note that this is the ONLY way you can access the Training Course materials and the feedback forms.    Please note that you need a NUCLEUS account to access the online platform. Outlined below are instructions for creating a NUCLEUS account if you do not have one already.   if !supportLists 1.  endif Create an account in Nucleus, by visiting https://websso.iaea.org and click on “Register” on top right-hand side of the screen. You will need to create a Username and Password that will be recorded in the NUCLEUS system.    if !supportLists 2.  endif Please be sure to use an email address which can be accessed from any PC/laptop/tablet or any wireless network and make note of your Username and Password as you will need it to Sign In to the system later.   if !supportLists 3.  endif Confirm the activation email that you will receive from Nucleus shortly after your registration; please click on “ Activation Link: Click here to activate ”.  To access the online platform, please enter the following Enrolment Key exactly as provided, which should provide you with direct access to the site. You will only need to enter this Key once. If you have any issues accessing the site, please do let us know.   Course: 04-08 October, 2021 Virtual Regional Training Course on the Preparation, Conduct, and Evaluation of Emergency Exercises to Test Preparedness and Response for a Nuclear or Radiological Emergency (iaea.org)  Enrolment Key : PCEeetpRNRE4 (Case Sensitive)    WebEx Training:    This workshop is a virtual event conducted by means of WebEx Training. WebEx Training has a feature of working in breakout sessions. Working in groups is an essential and extremely important part of this workshop. Please, DO NOT connect with your mobile phone . If connected with mobile phone, you will not have access to the breakout sessions.    To join the meeting please use the link from the email you will receive soon. WebEx will also send daily reminders, which also can be used for the purposes of joining this . DO NOT share the link . This Workshop is only for officially nominated participants.    If you have any troubles accessing the WebEx platform when you receive the invitation link, please, contact Mr Pat Kenny P.Kemail_363a2963007e9427 or Ms  Elise Nangula RATSCHMANN  email_86665f6f67b17bf4 .       We would appreciate if you join in advance (15 minutes before the event starts) so we have time to help you resolve whatever unexpected technical issues you may have.    Testing Session    We will hold a testing session for the participants on Thursday 30 September, at 2 pm Vienna Time.     The purpose of the testing session is to get familiar with the WebEx platform.  Please use the same PC/laptop, preferably equipped with a headset , that you will be using during the workshop, so that during testing session we are able to identify and eliminate all possible audio/connection issues that may arise during the event.    You will receive invitations for the testing session and the event shortly.    Agenda and Group Distribution (for breakout sessions):    Please get familiar with the Agenda ( attached) and your group according to the following distribution:        Group 1: Mr Alejandro Cortes    Group 2: Mr Prashant Maharaj    Group 3: Ms N ahla Fadlalla      Mr Mohammad Ali BOLOORCHI    Ms Narangerel ALGAA    Ms Laurentcia ARLANY      Mr Shahram DEHGHANI    Mr Usukhbayar TSENDGOMBO    Mr Kah Meng LEE      Mr Mohammad Mahdi HADIAN    Ms Margareth AUGUSTIN    Mr Adrian LEE      Mr Mahdiyar HAGHI    Mr Darcy DE ASIS    Mr Lewis LIM      Mr Mohammad Hadi JAFARI    Ms Alexa Belle DELA CRUZ    Mr Wai Yuen, Raymond LOH      Mr Seyed Ehsan MIR REZAEI     Mr ELISEO JR. DELA CRUZ    Mr S. SOMANESAN      Mr Mohammad NAZMABADI    Ms Milytoni EBO    Mr Jin Tang TAY      Mr AMIR HOSSEIN VOSOUGHI    Ms Mary Rose MUNDO    Mr Young Soon TAY      Mr Ahmad YAZDANI    Ms May VITUG    Mr Prageeth Indika Kumara KADADUNNA KORALALAGE      Mr Abdulsalam MEREE    Ms Piyaporn SINSROK    Mr Ajantha Ruwan Pushpa Kumara PONDAPELAGE      Mr Munhal IMRAN    Mr Hong Nhat DUONG    Mr Nilindra Pradeep PERERA           If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.    Thank you and looking forward to a successful workshop together!    Kind Regards,    Muzna    Ms Muzna ASSI | Emergency Preparedness Officer |  Incident Emergency Center | Department of Nuclear Safety and Security |  International Atomic Energy Agency | Vienna International Centre, PO Box 100, 1400 Vienna, Austria |  Email: M.Aemail_018f794d8c653274 | T: (+43-1) 2600-26395 | M: (+43) phone_no_66b9c19700fc39985 | F: (+43-1) 26007 |  Follow us on  www.iaea.org         ATOMS FOR PEACE AND DEVELOPMENT  Do not use these contact details for emergency communications  Follow @IAEAIEC for updates       This email message is intended only for the use of the named recipient. subject:
Fwd: "WS on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models
 for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and
 Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis"
full_text: To: email_266a829fac2c1c40 Sent: Monday, September 27, 2021 7:14:49 PM Subject: RE: "WS on Best Practices in Physical-Based Fault Rupture Models for Seismic Hazard Assessment of Nuclear Installations: Issues and Challenges toward Full Seismic Risk Analysis" Dear Amir, Salaam! I miss you long time. How are you doing? I am involving a part of TC project design relevant to external events. You want to have a workshop in terms of Deep Soil Mixing. We IAEA can conduct the workshop only based on the IAEA safety standards. Specific companies, SOILMEC and TREVI are not our partners. I would like to know more concrete ideas of your wishes and to seek availability of our side. DSM will be in new sites and you already started to phase 2, so the workshop might be too late to conduct. What do you expect? Based on the IAEA safety standards, potential of massive liquefaction is recommended as exclusion criteria of siting. Please give my best regards to my friends in Tehran. I am looking forwards to hearing from you. Khodahafez, Yushi. Mr Yoshimitsu Fukushima | Senior Safety Officer | Dr.(Eng.) I miss you long time.  How are you doing?    I am involving a part of TC project design relevant to external events.  You want to have a workshop in terms of Deep Soil Mixing.    We IAEA can conduct the workshop only based on the IAEA safety standards. Specific companies, SOILMEC and TREVI are not our partners. DSM will be in new sites and you already started to phase 2, so the workshop might be too late to conduct.  What do you expect? full_text: به: email_6ba5d0a2c7b3b77f, email_2f88527f5de609ba فرستاده شد: چهارشنبه 22 اردیبهشت 1400, 4:54:50 ب.ظ عنوان: صورتجلسات کمیته تخصصی اشتغال و خدمات فنی مهندسی در تاریخ های 1400/01/30 و 1400/02/08 با سلام و احترام؛ صورتجلسات کمیته تخصصی اشتغال و خدمات فنی مهندسی که جلسات آن به صورت فوق العاده در تاریخ های 1400/01/30 و 1400/02/08 برگزار شد بانضمام فایل پیوست مربوط به صورتجلسه تاریخ 1400/02/08، جهت استحضار و بهره برداری، به پیوست تقدیم حضورتان گردید.جناب شجاعی عزیز سلام و خدا قوت، ممنون بابت زحماتت، در صورتجلسه ها و قسمت اقدام کننده مخصوصا در جلسه 1400/01/30 به نظر میرسه اسم بنده رو لحاظ نفرمودید با توجه به نگهداری سوابق و در صورت نیاز جهت ویرایش و اطلاع بود ارادتمندیم از: "eshojaee" <email_633a63826069a6a5> به: email_6ba5d0a2c7b3b77f, email_2f88527f5de609ba فرستاده شد: چهارشنبه 22 اردیبهشت 1400,  4:54:50 ب.ظ عنوان: صورتجلسات کمیته تخصصی اشتغال و خدمات فنی مهندسی در تاریخ های 1400/01/30 و        1400/02/08 با سلام و احترام؛   صورتجلسات کمیته تخصصی اشتغال و خدمات فنی مهندسی که جلسات آن به صورت فوق العاده در تاریخ های 1400/01/30 و 1400/02/08 برگزار شد بانضمام فایل پیوست مربوط به صورتجلسه تاریخ 1400/02/08، جهت استحضار و بهره برداری، به پیوست تقدیم حضورتان گردید.

Unfortunately my dearest uncle passed away 3 days ago by COVID-19 and a lot of our relatives also in trouble with it, which is the biggest problem of our country now.    Thank you for profound respond. We all know about limitation and failure connected with welding plugs. All the effort performed to supply the reliable, safe, qualified and referenced Inspection and Plugging systems from your company. In order to obtain all required operational and design permission following would be beneficial to be indicated in the final Technical Commercial proposal which will be reflected in the contract:       - Previous licenses granted from Russian/Chinese/other countries’ regulatory authority to use inspection systems and mechanical plugs of INETEC.   - Previous Qualification Testing protocols from  Operating Organization for Inspection and plugging Modules.   - Reference explanatory note on reliability of INETEC plugging and inspection systems. 4.      The Qualification Testing condition of main inspection device should be provided.
