Please see my email below.    Best regards, ZrinkaSent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone Begin forwarded message:On Wednesday, August 18, 2021, 10:38 PM, Zrinka Corak wrote: Dear Mr. H.G.Dashti,   We are aware of the fact that the application of welded plug is defined in the technical specification. Such Gidropress standpoint arose from the time when the mechanical plug technology was not accessible and available for Gidropress.   30 years ago INETEC initiated mechanical plug application, and it was agreed with Gidropress that we would have mutual approach on possibility of mechanical plug application. Consequently, the mechanical plug qualification was prepared based on which Gidropress approved the use of mechanical plug. On grounds of the approved qualification, a great number of VVER nuclear power plants across the world have implemented mechanical plug, such as Finland, Armenia, Bulgaria, Hungary, Ukraine, China-more than 27.000 mechanical plugs have been installed.    We are pleased to say that some of mechanical plugs was installed 30 years ago and we have never faced any issues. That is not the case with the welded plug.   We know that welded plug technology still exists on certain nuclear power plants, and we have information that significant issues have appeared which have led to leakage after their installation. Therefore, we are confident that the use of mechanical plug is the needed and the best solution. In a case of signing the contract, you will gain insight into the qualification of mechanical plug which is approved by Gidropress.   Please let me know if you additional information or explanation on this subject is needed.   Best regards, Zrinka       From: email_5c503e5016c19dbd Sent: Wednesday, August 18, 2021 5:28 PMTo: Zrinka Corak Cc: Dusko Corak ;email_a190cc98813c23dc; email_cb822c85c6540f1d; email_2da35e4580091c1f;email_8f2f145198993460Subject: [Junk released by Allowed List] confirmation and consideration on Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Technical proposal   Dear Ms. Zrinka Corak   In reply to your technical proposal submitted on 10 August 2021, based on evaluation performed on our plant and headquarter, the technical offer is confirmed as noted by considering following comments. 1.      The plant designer procedure indicate that plugs should be sealed by welds. Considering the fact that you provide long reference on mechanical tubes  in your correspondence and  are included in the offer, please provide technical reference note on non-necessity for plug welding which could be the basis for Technical Conclusion for acquiring Russian Chief Designer. In this regards, indication of the previous approval of VVER General Designer would be beneficial. (included) 2.      The plug welding module specification and qouatation would be suitable excluding from the current contract. (if any) (excluded) 3.      The Qualification Testing condition of main inspection device should be provided. (included) 4.      The guarantee terms should include in technical offer. (included) 5.      After sale services and technical support services should be provided. (excluded)   Your kind attention in this regard is highly appreciated.   Faithfully yours H.G.Dashti     Begin forwarded message: On Tuesday, August 10, 2021, 9:55 PM, Zrinka Corak wrote: Dear Mr. H.G. Dashti, Our proposal is enclosed. You may notice that the commercial part has not been completed. We suggest that once you confirm the scope of delivery, we submit to you the commercial part. If you need any additional information and/or explanation, please let me know. Kind regards, Zrinka Sent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone Begin forwarded message:On Saturday, August 7, 2021, 5:24 PM, email_5c503e5016c19dbd wrote: Dear Ms. Zrinka Corak subject: Reply Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services   in respond to the request of confirmation dated august 3, 2021 please notify followings: 1.    the term "A new SG inspection and plugging equipment including eddy current system, plugging system, plugs, training and inspection." is confirmed as noted by adding Ultrasonic Inspection module. please provide Technical Commercial Proposal (TCP). 2.    the term "A contaminated SG inspection and plugging equipment including eddy current system, plugging system, plugs, training and inspection" is confirmed as noted by adding Ultrasonic Inspection module. please provide TCP. 3.    the term "Your nuclear power plant is VVER-1000, therefore, we deem you do not need ultrasound inspection system." is not confirmed. the UT module is required for collector welds and ligament possible inspection. please include UT system to your TCP as it is indicated in RFP June 29, 2021. your kind action in this regard is highly appreciated.     Faithfully yours H.G.Dashti Equipment Supply Manager NPPD corporation Demail_d56c1955a6b05dfc, +phone_no_dd7a8474deeacbea11   از:"zrinka corak" به:email_5c503e5016c19dbdرونوشت:"jafari" , "WORK" فرستاده شد:سه شنبه 12 مرداد 1400,  8:53:36ب.ظعنوان:Fw: Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services   Dear Mr. H.G.Dashti,   I received the notification that the below e-mail failed to be delivered.  Therefore, I am resending the e-mail.   Kind regards, Zrinka       From: Zrinka CorakSent: Tuesday, August 3, 2021 2:58:54 PMTo: email_5c503e5016c19dbd; Dusko CorakCc: jafari; email_db59fbe8929eeb73Subject: RE: Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services    Dear Mr. H.G. Dashti,   Thank you for the below information. Based on your request we will send you the proposal. However, for the purpose of preparing the proposal please confirm the following:   § A new SG inspection and plugging equipment including eddy current system, plugging system, plugs, training and inspection. § A contaminated SG inspection and plugging equipment including eddy current system, plugging system, plugs, training and inspection.   Your nuclear power plant is VVER-1000, therefore, we deem you do not need ultrasound inspection system. Please confirm it.   Kind regards, Zrinka     From:email_5c503e5016c19dbd Sent: Sunday, August 1, 2021 6:33 PMTo: Zrinka Corak ; Dusko Corak Cc: jafari Subject: [Junk released by Allowed List] Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services   Attendant: INETEC Corporation Subject: Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Dear Mrs. Zrinka Corak In response to your letter dated 06 July 2021 based on the activities performed at NPPD corporation, following are to be notified: 1.    The straight cooperation with leading companies as INETEC would be effective and beneficial for the safe and commercial operation in scientific, technical and technological aspects and it is highly acclaimed by our policy. 2.    It is noticeable that the supply and services for BNPP-1 are not constrained at all and based on IAEA rules no problematic concerns exist for the safe operation of commercial nuclear power plants. 3.    Recently, the necessary correspondences through our deputy of foreign affair and IAEA counterpart performed to facilitate the cooperation with INETEC Company. Therefore, the subsequent request of INETEC company from IAEA would be supported by our representative. 4.    All necessary technical and contractual issues should be considered after the official quote based on state of affairs. Your kind action in this regard is highly appreciated.   Faithfully yours H.G.Dashti Equipment Supply Manager NPPD corporation Demail_d56c1955a6b05dfc, +phone_no_dd7a8474deeacbea11

subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"
full_text: To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Cc: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Sent: Tuesday, September 28, 2021 11:19:42 AMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Добрый день уважаемый Хоссейн!Вы поняли не совсем правильно. Вы будете отвечать за области СО.1 и СО.2, но Вы в группе, которая посещает Смоленскую АЭС и проводить интервью будете в компании Романова Евгения, он ответственный от АТЭ за эту КПП.С уважением,Сергей Шишкин Руководитель проектаКорпоративные партнерские проверкиВАО АЭС-МЦTel.: +7(495) 221 02-94E-mail: email_68929698492ab1ff-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Tuesday, September 28, 2021 8:54 AMTo: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Cc: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey,I am sorry for the delay in responding to your email. There was a problem with my email yesterday that I could read the emails but had trouble replying.I agree with your proposal. This means that the first week we will go to Novovoronezh and work with Gaetan for reviewing CO.1,2.Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" , "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 7:22:29 PMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн, добрый день!Направляю распределение областей так, как я это вижу. Романов (ответственный от компании), Тарушко без корпоративного опыта и участвует первый раз. Предлагаю вам работать с Гаетаном в областях СО.1 и СО.2. На второй неделе отвлечешься на роль Советника Отрасли, то есть принять участие в разговорах с руководителями АТЭ.С уважением,Сергей Шишкин-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 4:01 PMTo: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear sergey,Given that the reviewers in Areas 1 and 2 are present, and given your experiences with the presence of an industry advisor, how effective and necessary do you think my presence will be from November 7th?Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Cc: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 3:59:10 PMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Извиняюсь, "Корпоративное лидерство" - это СО.1-----Original Message-----From: Фаллер Сергей ВикторовичSent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 3:27 PMTo: email_fb9dc050b654b8ca' Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн,я совсем не против, если ты направишь свой фокус на проверку "Корпоративного лидерства (СО.2)" или "Корпоративного руководства (СО.2)".В любом случае мы рассчитываем, что ты прилетишь 7-го ноября и примешь участие в КПП с самого начала.С уважением,Сергей Фаллер-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 1:52 PMTo: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey.It should also be noted that according to the TDMF form sent by WANO-Mc, I had announced my readiness to participate in areas 1 and 2. Maybe it would have been better if you had raised this issue with me.Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: email_a190cc98813c23dcTo: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Cc: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 1:54:56 PMSubject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey,In this case, I do not think my presence will be so beneficial for almost two weeks-as stated in WANO-MC letter, during all stage of CPR in Moscow. Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Cc: "Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin)" Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 10:44:17 AMSubject: RE: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн, здравствуй!Мы не стали назначать тебя ответственным за какую-либо область проверки, потому что на заключительном этапе КПП хотели бы возложить на тебя функции Отраслевого Советника.Всего наилучшего,Сергей Фаллер-----Original Message-----From: email_a190cc98813c23dc Sent: Sunday, September 26, 2021 10:03 AMTo: Фаллер Сергей Викторович Cc: Шишкин Сергей Александрович (Sergey Shishkin) Subject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Sergey,I hope you are all well and healthy. would you please tell me in which area I will work in the CPR of the ATE?Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: email_a190cc98813c23dcTo: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" Sent: Sunday, September 19, 2021 9:10:34 AMSubject: Re: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Dear Serge,thank you.Best Regards, Hossien DerakhshandehDeputy Managing Director for Technical and Engineering Nuclear Power Production and Development Co. of Iran (NPPD)----- Original Message -----From: "Фаллер Сергей Викторович" To: "DERAKHSHANDEH Hossein" Sent: Thursday, September 16, 2021 3:57:04 PMSubject: FW: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Хоссейн, добрый день!Во вложении - письмо МЦ, которое сегодня было направлено в NPPD.Best regards,Sergey FallerWANO MC, Peer Reviews – AdviserTel: phone_no_c35ff30ebd277313, ext.164Cell: phone_no_2813b3fe2c6e4c28E-mail: email_cf90a25c8e7998bd25 Ferganskaya, Moscow, 109507-----Original Message-----From: documents Sent: Thursday, September 16, 2021 2:13 PMTo: email_5a6c316153be0052; email_20ea1f06a3226d7e; Фаллер Сергей Викторович Subject: Letter "Expert for Corporate Peer Review"Please read the attached document.Это сообщение автоматически сформировано системой электронного документооборота Если у Вас возникли вопросы, Вы сможете обратится поТел: +7 (495) 376-15-87Факс: +7 (495) 376-08-97E-mail: email_3d8693a16356cfc5infoС уважением,ВАО АЭС-МЦThis message is automatically generated by the electronic document management system If you have any questions, you can contactTel: +7 (495) 376-15-87Fax : +7 (495) 376-08-97E-mail: email_3d8693a16356cfc5infoSincerely,WANO-MC

subject: WNN Weekly, 21-27 September 2021
full_text: View in browser [ https://wna.informz.ca/InformzDataService/OnlineVersion/Individual?mailingInstanceId=1294291&subscriberId=912844357 ]28 September 2021https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/GAO-calls-on-Congress-to-break-used-fuel-disposalGAO calls on Congress to break used fuel disposal impasse [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/GAO-calls-on-Congress-to-break-used-fuel-disposal ] Congress needs to take action to break the impasse over a permanent solution for commercial used nuclear fuel, according to a report from the US Government Accountability Office. The report identifies four matters for congressional consideration - including amending legislation to authorise a new consent-based siting process and restructuring the Nuclear Waste Fund - and recommends that the Department of Energy finalise its consent-based siting process.Nuclear needed for hydrogen production, study says [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Nuclear-needed-for-hydrogen-production,-study-says ] To facilitate rapid decarbonisation and cut dependency on fossil fuels, both nuclear energy and renewables are needed for power and hydrogen production, a new independent study has concluded. The study, by Aurora Energy Research, investigates the benefits of deploying both nuclear and renewables for hydrogen production, to support the energy transition and meet UK climate targets.NuScale signs agreement with new Polish partners to replace coal [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/NuScale-signs-with-new-Polish-partners-to-replace ] NuScale has signed a second agreement to consider its small reactors as a general replacement for coal units in Poland. The US small reactor vendor will support two energy firms, Poland-based Unimot and USA-based Getka, in their joint work to explore the possibility.CNSC confirms orders on CANDU restarts [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/CNSC-confirms-orders-on-CANDU-restarts ] The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission has confirmed or amended orders issued to Bruce Power and Ontario Power Generation related to pressure tube fitness for service following a public hearing held on 10 September. The regulator confirmed the orders issued for certain units at the Bruce, Darlington and Pickering CANDU plants, but removed Pickering units 1 and 4 from the list. It said it will consider restart requests for the reactors concerned on a case-by-case basis.Tokamak Energy develops new magnet protection technology [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Tokamak-Energy-develops-new-magnet-protection-tech ] Tokamak Energy of the UK announced it has demonstrated a transformative magnet protection technology that improves the commercial viability of fusion power plants, delivering higher performance than alternative magnet systems. It said results from the latest tests validate a revolutionary approach to scaling up high-temperature superconducting magnets, which are highly resilient to plasma disruptions.Group of Vienna aims to tackle global challenges [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Group-of-Vienna-aims-to-tackle-global-challenges ] Global nuclear industry leaders have agreed to work together with the head of the International Atomic Energy Agency as the Group of Vienna to apply nuclear energy to addressing climate change and advancing sustainable development.Polish companies sign MoUs on SMR deployment and supply chain [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Polish-companies-sign-MoUs-on-SMR-deployment-and-s ] Two separate agreements have been announced between Polish companies and North American small modular reactor vendors and suppliers. A memorandum of understanding between Cameco, GE Hitachi Nuclear Energy, GEH SMR Technologies Canada Ltd and Synthos Green Energy will see those companies evaluate a potential Canadian supply chain for a fleet of BWRX-300 reactors in Poland. Separately, NuScale Power, KGHM Polska Miedź SA and Piela Business Engineering are to explore the deployment of NuScale's SMR technology to repower or repurpose existing coal-fired power plants.Companies sign agreement to increase Ukrainian power output [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Companies-sign-agreement-to-increase-Ukrainian-pow ] Westinghouse Electric Company and Ukrainian company NT-Engineering LLC have signed a Memorandum of Cooperation to implement maintenance optimisation and system repair projects for VVER reactors. They said the work will increase the safety levels and performance of Ukrainian VVERs, improving annual power output and reducing operational costs.Normandy restates its support for EPRs at Penly [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Normandy-restates-its-support-for-EPRs-at-Penly ] Local elected officials from the region around the Penly nuclear power plant in Normandy, northern France, have reiterated their support for the construction of two EPR2 reactors at the site. In a manifesto expressing their support, they say such a project - representing an investment of about EUR15 billion (USD17 billion) - would have a significant positive socio-economic impact on the region.More funding needed to complete Central Asian remediation [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/More-funding-needed-to-complete-Central-Asian-reme ] A renewed call has been made for additional donor funding in order to tackle the most urgent problems caused by radioactive and toxic waste at legacy uranium sites in Central Asia, with the International Atomic Energy Agency estimating an additional EUR40 million (USD47 million) is required. The call came as all parties directly involved in the project signed a revised Strategic Master Plan.South Africa planning to start nuclear procurement [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/South-Africa-planning-to-start-nuclear-procurement ] South Africa plans to issue a Request for Proposal for 2500 MWe of new nuclear capacity at the end of March 2022 and complete the procurement process in 2024, Deputy Minister of Mineral Resources and Energy Nobuhle Pamela Nkabane told the International Atomic Energy Agency 65th General Conference. The country is also finalising its ratification of the amended Convention on Physical Protection of Nuclear Material.EU, IAEA extend cooperation in nuclear safety [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/EU-IAEA-extend-cooperation-in-nuclear-safety ] The European Union and the International Atomic Energy Agency have extended a 2013 agreement to cooperate on nuclear safety. Their cooperation has already led to over one hundred nuclear safety review missions, environmental remediation at former uranium sites in Central Asia and more effective radioactive waste management in Africa.Uranium mining goes digital in Russia [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Uranium-mining-goes-digital-in-Russia ] 'Digital' mining has started at the Khokhlovskoye uranium deposit in Russia, Rosatom subsidiaries announced. Operators have full information on the process and its environmental effects, as well as simulation of their options.Abu Dhabi launches clean energy certificate scheme [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Abu-Dhabi-launches-clean-energy-certificate-scheme ] The Abu Dhabi Department of Energy has issued a regulatory policy for implementing a clean energy certificates scheme it says will cater to a growing appetite among businesses and consumers to contribute to the fight against climate change. The scheme provides an accreditation system based on internationally recognised standards and lays the foundations for a market for trading renewable and nuclear energy attributes.Trial of advanced fuel begins at Rostov [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Trial-of-advanced-fuel-begins-at-Rostov ] Advanced fuel assemblies have begun an operational trial at Russia's Rostov nuclear power plant. Fuel manufacturer TVEL said if successful they would provide a higher level of performance and safety. "Fuel irradiation in a commercial reactor is an important step for the further commercialisation of this product," said Natalia Nikipelova, president of TVEL, adding: "It is symbolic that this milestone is achieved when TVEL celebrates its 25th anniversary."International event focuses on nuclear supply chain [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/International-event-focuses-on-nuclear-supply-chai ] The nuclear industry will need to achieve even closer coordination among licensees, regulators and suppliers to ensure its supply chain can efficiently meet the needs of buyers, according to participants in an event held by Foratom and the International Atomic Energy Agency. Some of the changes instigated to deal with the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic, including remote working and the use of digital platforms, are here to stay.Second Belarusian reactor nears operation [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/Second-Belarusian-reactor-nears-operation ] Ostrovets 2 is at the hot test stage of commissioning and should begin generating electricity next year, Belarusian energy minister Viktor Karankevich said on the sidelines of the International Atomic Energy Agency's General Conference on 20 September. "Nuclear and radiation safety is an unconditional priority for our country, and we strictly adhere to it, developing cooperation with our international partners on the principles of openness and transparency," Karankevich stressed in a speech at Belarus' exhibition stand.New Orano research centre inaugurated [ https://www.world-nuclear-news.org/Articles/New-Orano-research-centre-inaugurated ] Orano's new Centre for Innovation in Extractive Metallurgy facility at its Bessines-sur-Gartempe site in the New Aquitaine region of France has been inaugurated by French Prime Minister Jean Castex. The new facility - one of the group's main R&D centres - will host industrial pilot tests for Orano projects under development, in particular for the recycling and recovery of radioactive and non-radioactive materials.facebookhttps://www.facebook.com/WorldNuclearNews      twitterhttps://twitter.com/W_Nuclear_News      linkedinhttps://www.linkedin.com/groups/8558417/World Nuclear Association, Tower House, 10 Southampton Street, London WC2E 7HA, UK© World Nuclear Association. Registered in England and Wales, company number 01215741.Unsubscribe [ http://WNA.informz.ca/WNA/pages/default_unsubscribe?_zs=nnWeM1&_zmi=Ljc6 ]Powered by Higher Logic   https://www.higherlogic.com/resources/anti-spam-policy                     View in browser                                             28 September 2021                                                                        GAO calls on Congress to break used fuel disposal impasse  Congress needs to take action to break the impasse over a permanent solution for commercial used nuclear fuel, according to a report from the US Government Accountability Office. The report identifies four matters for congressional consideration - including amending legislation to authorise a new consent-based siting process and restructuring the Nuclear Waste Fund - and recommends that the Department of Energy finalise its consent-based siting process.                               Nuclear needed for hydrogen production, study says  To facilitate rapid decarbonisation and cut dependency on fossil fuels, both nuclear energy and renewables are needed for power and hydrogen production, a new independent study has concluded. The study, by Aurora Energy Research, investigates the benefits of deploying both nuclear and renewables for hydrogen production, to support the energy transition and meet UK climate targets.                               NuScale signs agreement with new Polish partners to replace coal  NuScale has signed a second agreement to consider its small reactors as a general replacement for coal units in Poland. The US small reactor vendor will support two energy firms, Poland-based Unimot and USA-based Getka, in their joint work to explore the possibility.                               CNSC confirms orders on CANDU restarts  The Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission has confirmed or amended orders issued to Bruce Power and Ontario Power Generation related to pressure tube fitness for service following a public hearing held on 10 September. The regulator confirmed the orders issued for certain units at the Bruce, Darlington and Pickering CANDU plants, but removed Pickering units 1 and 4 from the list. It said it will consider restart requests for the reactors concerned on a case-by-case basis.                               Tokamak Energy develops new magnet protection technology  Tokamak Energy of the UK announced it has demonstrated a transformative magnet protection technology that improves the commercial viability of fusion power plants, delivering higher performance than alternative magnet systems. It said results from the latest tests validate a revolutionary approach to scaling up high-temperature superconducting magnets, which are highly resilient to plasma disruptions.                               Group of Vienna aims to tackle global challenges  Global nuclear industry leaders have agreed to work together with the head of the International Atomic Energy Agency as the Group of Vienna to apply nuclear energy to addressing climate change and advancing sustainable development.                               Polish companies sign MoUs on SMR deployment and supply chain  Two separate agreements have been announced between Polish companies and North American small modular reactor vendors and suppliers. A memorandum of understanding between Cameco, GE Hitachi Nuclear Energy, GEH SMR Technologies Canada Ltd and Synthos Green Energy will see those companies evaluate a potential Canadian supply chain for a fleet of BWRX-300 reactors in Poland. Separately, NuScale Power, KGHM Polska Miedź SA and Piela Business Engineering are to explore the deployment of NuScale's SMR technology to repower or repurpose existing coal-fired power plants.                               Companies sign agreement to increase Ukrainian power output  Westinghouse Electric Company and Ukrainian company NT-Engineering LLC have signed a Memorandum of Cooperation to implement maintenance optimisation and system repair projects for VVER reactors. They said the work will increase the safety levels and performance of Ukrainian VVERs, improving annual power output and reducing operational costs.                               Normandy restates its support for EPRs at Penly  Local elected officials from the region around the Penly nuclear power plant in Normandy, northern France, have reiterated their support for the construction of two EPR2 reactors at the site. In a manifesto expressing their support, they say such a project - representing an investment of about EUR15 billion (USD17 billion) - would have a significant positive socio-economic impact on the region.                               More funding needed to complete Central Asian remediation  A renewed call has been made for additional donor funding in order to tackle the most urgent problems caused by radioactive and toxic waste at legacy uranium sites in Central Asia, with the International Atomic Energy Agency estimating an additional EUR40 million (USD47 million) is required. The call came as all parties directly involved in the project signed a revised Strategic Master Plan.                               South Africa planning to start nuclear procurement  South Africa plans to issue a Request for Proposal for 2500 MWe of new nuclear capacity at the end of March 2022 and complete the procurement process in 2024, Deputy Minister of Mineral Resources and Energy Nobuhle Pamela Nkabane told the International Atomic Energy Agency 65th General Conference . The country is also finalising its ratification of the amended Convention on Physical Protection of Nuclear Material.                               EU, IAEA extend cooperation in nuclear safety  The European Union and the International Atomic Energy Agency have extended a 2013 agreement to cooperate on nuclear safety. Their cooperation has already led to over one hundred nuclear safety review missions, environmental remediation at former uranium sites in Central Asia and more effective radioactive waste management in Africa.                              Uranium mining goes digital in Russia  'Digital' mining has started at the Khokhlovskoye uranium deposit in Russia, Rosatom subsidiaries announced. Operators have full information on the process and its environmental effects, as well as simulation of their options.                               Abu Dhabi launches clean energy certificate scheme  The Abu Dhabi Department of Energy has issued a regulatory policy for implementing a clean energy certificates scheme it says will cater to a growing appetite among businesses and consumers to contribute to the fight against climate change. The scheme provides an accreditation system based on internationally recognised standards and lays the foundations for a market for trading renewable and nuclear energy attributes.                               Trial of advanced fuel begins at Rostov  Advanced fuel assemblies have begun an operational trial at Russia's Rostov nuclear power plant. Fuel manufacturer TVEL said if successful they would provide a higher level of performance and safety. "Fuel irradiation in a commercial reactor is an important step for the further commercialisation of this product," said Natalia Nikipelova, president of TVEL, adding: "It is symbolic that this milestone is achieved when TVEL celebrates its 25th anniversary."                               International event focuses on nuclear supply chain  The nuclear industry will need to achieve even closer coordination among licensees, regulators and suppliers to ensure its supply chain can efficiently meet the needs of buyers, according to participants in an event held by Foratom and the International Atomic Energy Agency. Some of the changes instigated to deal with the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic, including remote working and the use of digital platforms, are here to stay.                               Second Belarusian reactor nears operation  Ostrovets 2 is at the hot test stage of commissioning and should begin generating electricity next year, Belarusian energy minister Viktor Karankevich said on the sidelines of the International Atomic Energy Agency's General Conference on 20 September. "Nuclear and radiation safety is an unconditional priority for our country, and we strictly adhere to it, developing cooperation with our international partners on the principles of openness and transparency," Karankevich stressed in a speech at Belarus' exhibition stand.                              New Orano research centre inaugurated  Orano's new Centre for Innovation in Extractive Metallurgy facility at its Bessines-sur-Gartempe site in the New Aquitaine region of France has been inaugurated by French Prime Minister Jean Castex. The new facility - one of the group's main R&D centres - will host industrial pilot tests for Orano projects under development, in particular for the recycling and recovery of radioactive and non-radioactive materials. subject: Re: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna
full_text: به: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e فرستاده شد: سه شنبه 6 مهر 1400, 11:26:32 ق.ظ عنوان: RE: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna Dear Kheirollahi, I will ask your reply to IT expert. Just wait a little. Regards Ki Sig KANG From: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e Sent: Tuesday, September 28, 2021 8:59 AM To: KiSig Kang Cc: derakhshandeh ; peyman Toorafshan ; rahnama Subject: Re: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna Hello Mr. Kang Thank you for your attention, based on coordination with NPPD computer experts, unfortunately, it is not possible to connect from Iran using ZOOM. At the same time, for connecting via IP video conferencing, if you ask computer experts, they probably have the experience of connecting this way, such as in the context of sysco or POLYCOM or any other video conferencing hardware, allowing ip and connection of all parties to it. has it. In case of communication, this communication will be tripartite between you, Tehran (NPPD, consultant and technical support company) and Bushehr site (operation company), a total of 4-5 specialists and a translator in Bushehr, which of course in Tehran, if necessary. In the continuation of the meeting, we will use your guidance regarding the general favorable situation of CM in a nuclear power plant in South Korea. I will review the submission of photos and brief records of the experts participating in the meeting. subject: We supply updated World Wide Standards in spic.ir/ishop
full_text: باسلام و احترام،سامانه استانداردهاي جهاني پويش آپديت شد. شرکت ساعي پويش با بيش از سي سال تجربه در زمينه تهيه منابع علمي - فني و مهندسي از سراسر جهان، اکنون استانداردهاي فني مهندسي و توليدي صنعتي آپديت شده جهاني را به صورت آنلاين  در اختيار قرار ميدهد.لطفا براي دريافت متن کامل استاندارد به سامانه پويش مراجعه نماييد.  اگر اين ايميل باعث رنجش شما شده عذرخواهي مي کنيم و با اعلام  شما از ليست حذف ميشود. We apologize if this email has offended you and will be removed from the list if announce.  با تشکر - شركت ساعي پويشتهران، خيابان قائم مقام فراهاني، بالاتر از خيابان مطهري خيابان دوم ب، شماره 16، طبقه چهارم، واحد 16تلفن: 9-88502147دورنگار: 88751584    باسلام و احترام،  سامانه استانداردهاي جهاني پويش آپديت شد.    شرکت ساعي پويش با بيش از سي سال تجربه در زمينه تهيه منابع علمي - فني و مهندسي از  سراسر جهان، اکنون  استانداردهاي فني مهندسي و توليدي صنعتي آپديت شده جهاني را به صورت آنلاين در اختيار قرار ميدهد.  لطفا براي دريافت متن کامل استاندارد به سامانه پويش مراجعه نماييد.      اگر اين  ايميل باعث رنجش شما شده عذرخواهي مي کنيم و با اعلام  شما از ليست حذف ميشود. Regards Ki Sig KANG From: email_cdf6d623d6dcab7e Sent: Sunday, September 19, 2021 8:58 AM To: KiSig Kang Cc: email_266a829fac2c1c40 ; peyman Toorafshan ; derakhshandeh Subject: Re: Hello Amir, NPPD from Ki Sig KANG at Vienna Hello Mr. Kang While respecting and thanking you, regarding the use of webex for online communication, unfortunately Iran is a sanction in this regard and we only need to determine an IP by you and we can communicate with you via video conference. In case of communication, this communication will be tripartite between you, Tehran (NPPD, consultant and technical support company) and Bushehr site (operation company), a total of 4-5 specialists and a translator in Bushehr, which of course in Tehran, if necessary. We will use a translator. After introducing the participants, a presentation regarding the status of CM in Bushehr will be presented by the expert of the operation company. In the continuation of the meeting, we will use your guidance regarding the general favorable situation of CM in a nuclear power plant in South Korea. If you agree, we will pursue the main strategy of examining the issue using distance analysis to achieve the goal. The above items are completely consistent with the items mentioned in your submitted file, and we will achieve the desired results. I will review the submission of photos and brief records of the experts participating in the meeting. To make more productive results, I have a few questions as follow;     * Do you hire an interpreter for simultaneous translation ? ( We will use English)     * How many people will join the meeting ? In case of Korea side, five or six people will join the meeting.     * Can I ask you your interesting points or issues on CM to be solved     * Can you prepare your participant introduction slides ? ( see attached file)     * Let me know the e-mail list for invitation. Thanks for your interesting. Regards Ki Sig Kang, Ph.D, P.E. subject: Register Now! Performance Indicator I-WG Meeting, 19-21 October 2021
full_text: PI Support SessionAs part of the registration, we will as you: "Are there any PI topics or areas you need advice or assistance with?"While we are not able to meet face-to-face, this is an opportunity for you, our members, to make connections with one another, provide support where possible, and tackle common PI issues. One utility may be strong in an area where another is weak.As and when we start to receive registrations, the answers will be posted on the 'PI Support Session' tab of the event website. Please review these answers and come to the meeting ready to share your advice and support other members where possible, i.e., sharing best practices.Pre Job BriefA meeting for all participants will be arranged around one week prior to the I-WG meeting. This meeting will be an opportunity for:*         Participants to test their connection*         New members of the I-WG to introduce themselves*         An agenda run-through*         Any participant questions to be answeredApril 2021 Meeting MaterialsClick the button below to view the meeting materials from the virtual meeting in April 2021. Materials include presentations and supporting documents. To access the meeting recordings, or for support accessing Nuclear Community, please contact email_13abebf7d2795191 .[cid:email_6437131478bb644c01D7B516.498A0910] If you have any questions, or would like to be removed from the PI I-WG mailing list, please email email_13abebf7d2795191 .[YouTube] [Website] [LinkedIn] [Facebook] [Twitter] Copyright (c) 2021 World Association Nuclear Operators, All rights reserved.You are receiving this email because you are a member of the Performance Indicator Industry Working Group.Our postal address is:World Association of Nuclear Operators25 Canada SquareLondon, E14 5LQUnited Kingdom               Performance Indicator I-WG Virtual Meeting  19-21 October 2021, 10:00-12:30 UTC/GMT         Dear Abbasi,      It is our pleasure to invite you to the Performance Indicator I-WG Virtual Meeting that will be held on Microsoft Teams from 19 to 21 October 2021.     The Performance Indicator Working Group (PI I-WG) is comprised of representatives from utility personnel (also referred to as the “PI community”) dedicated to improving the reliability, scope and use of performance indicators to help drive improved nuclear safety performance.      Click the button below to access the event website where you can register for the meeting, and view materials such as the agenda, connection details, and time zone information.      Use access code: PI21             PI Support Session      As part of the registration, we will as you: “Are there any PI topics or areas you need advice or assistance with?”      While we are not able to meet face-to-face, this is an opportunity for you, our members, to make connections with one another, provide support where possible, and tackle common PI issues. One utility may be strong in an area where another is weak.      As and when we start to receive registrations, the answers will be posted on the ‘PI Support Session’ tab of the event website. Please review these answers and come to the meeting ready to share your advice and support other members where possible, i.e., sharing best practices.       Pre Job Brief   A meeting for all participants will be arranged around one week prior to the I-WG meeting. This meeting will be an opportunity for:             if !supportLists ·  endif Participants to test their connection   if !supportLists ·  endif New members of the I-WG to introduce themselves   if !supportLists ·  endif An agenda run-through   if !supportLists ·  endif Any participant questions to be answered              April 2021 Meeting Materials    Click the button below to view the meeting materials from the virtual meeting in April 2021. Materials include presentations and supporting documents. To access the meeting recordings, or for support accessing Nuclear Community, please contact email_13abebf7d2795191 .             If you have any questions, or would like to be removed from the PI I-WG mailing list, please email email_13abebf7d2795191 .                          Copyright © 2021 World Association Nuclear Operators, All rights reserved.  You are receiving this email because you are a member of the Performance Indicator Industry Working Group.    Our postal address is:  World Association of Nuclear Operators  25 Canada Square  London, E14 5LQ  United Kingdom

subject: داوری مقاله 1 (#NST-0007-1655)
full_text: کد مقاله: NST-0007-1655عنوان مقاله: آنالیز اثرات انواع گردش طبیعی جریان بر میزان انتشار مواد رادیواکتیو در طی حادثه شدید نیروگاه PWRداور گرامی: دکتر سعید  فتورچیانبا سلام و احترام، با توجه به سوابق ارزشمند جناب عالی، به پیوست مقاله آنالیز اثرات انواع گردش طبیعی جریان بر میزان انتشار مواد رادیواکتیو در طی حادثه شدید نیروگاه PWR که برای بررسی به مجله مجله علوم  و  فنون هسته ای ارسال شده است، حضورتان ایفاد می گردد. خواهشمند است درصورت تمایل به داوری آن، ضمن اعلام موافقت نظرات خود را در تاریخ اعلام شده ارسال فرمایید.یادآور می شود مهلت پاسخ حداکثر تا 1400-07-19 است و دریافت نکردن پاسخ به منزله انصراف از داوری محسوب می شود.لطفا آمادگی خود برای داوری مقاله را با کلیک روی گزینه های "قبول" یا "رد" اعلان فرمایید.قبول: https://jonsat.nstri.ir/reviewer?_ad=4Oq2XYpMVmvqIp_Vt.58yLl6A8cw_2tHy9nlmdyqkfmNfC3VIAHoVSAtnE34X_iMرد: https://jonsat.nstri.ir/reviewer?_ad=QWUzrFq3Z_k73zuoTZBlQIK6Q33Ux9_r0vqbgXdD3FAMH_iDjkp182ZZv_YX6fTW برای دسترسی مستقیم به صفحه داوری مقاله روی این لینک کلیک کنید:https://jonsat.nstri.ir/reviewer?_ad=Q9ARou90z1FRdrrFKT_Q9HOWR6u_RfHzzwiOOzbilFIXweLsXJF1Yx_6mQkKmLf5 توضیحات سردبیر / دبیر تخصصی: با تشکر،مجله علوم و فنون  هسته ایسردبیر مجله علوم  و  فنون هسته ایمشخصات مقالهعنوان: آنالیز اثرات انواع گردش طبیعی جریان بر میزان انتشار مواد رادیواکتیو در طی حادثه شدید نیروگاه PWRچکیده: مکانیزم شکست ناشی از خزش در طی حادثه شدید یک راکتور آبیتحتفشار بهجهت انتقال مواد رادیواکتیو به محیطزیست از اهمیت ویژهای برخوردار است. به دنبال یک حادثه شدید، حرارت واپاشی منتقلشده به سایر قسمتهای سیستمخنککننده راکتور میتواند منجر به گرمشدن سازههای سیستم خنککننده راکتور (RCS) و خرابی نواحی تحتفشار آسیبپذیر شود. حادثه قطعکاملبرق (SBO) بدون اقدامات اپراتور (توالی TMLB) یکی از محتملترین سناریوهایی است که ممکن است یکپارچگی RCS تحتفشار را تهدید کند. در این توالی، محل شکست RCS به نوع پدیده گردشطبیعی سیال مدار اولیه راکتور بستگی دارد. در این تحقیق، تجزیهوتحلیل حساسیت شکستناشی از خزش لولههایمولدبخار (SGTR) و خطلولهاصلیگرم خنککننده راکتور به نوع پدیده گردشطبیعی، یعنی جریانهمسو و غیرهمسو، با استفاده از کد MELCOR بررسی شدهاست. نتایج حاصل از دو مدل جریانگردشطبیعی همسو و غیرهمسو نشانمیدهد هنگامی که پدیده گردشطبیعیغیرهمسو غالب است، شکستناشی از خزش خطلولهاصلیگرم خنککننده راکتور زودتر از دستهلولههای مولدبخار رخمیدهد. درصورتیکه در اثر گردشطبیعی همسو لولههایمولدبخار زودتر از سایر بخشهای خطوطاصلی سیستمخنککننده راکتور دچار شکستناشی از خزش میشود. علاوه بر این، مقدار مواد رادیواکتیو منتشرشده به قسمتهای مختلف نیروگاه و محیطزیست برای هر دو مدل برآوردشدهاست. نتایج نشانمیدهد که براساس شکست، برای مدلهای گردشطبیعیهمسو و غیرهمسو بهترتیب 18کیلوگرم و 145.76 کیلوگرم مواد رادیواکتیو بهصورت آئروسل و بخارمحصولاتشکافت به محفظهایمنیراکتور تخلیهمیشود. از طرفدیگر، در گردشطبیعیهمسو، حدود 136.33 کیلوگرم مواد رادیواکتیو به صورت بخار و آئروسل، از طریق شیرایمنی خطاصلیبخار به محیطزیست منتشرمیشود.   کد مقاله: NST-0007-1655   عنوان مقاله: آنالیز اثرات انواع گردش طبیعی جریان بر میزان انتشار مواد رادیواکتیو در طی حادثه شدید نیروگاه PWR   داور گرامی: دکتر سعید  فتورچیان   با سلام و احترام،      با توجه به سوابق ارزشمند جناب عالی، به پیوست مقاله آنالیز اثرات انواع گردش طبیعی جریان بر میزان انتشار مواد رادیواکتیو در طی حادثه شدید نیروگاه PWR که برای بررسی به مجله مجله علوم  و  فنون هسته ای ارسال شده است، حضورتان ایفاد می گردد. خواهشمند است درصورت تمایل به داوری آن، ضمن اعلام موافقت نظرات خود را در تاریخ اعلام شده ارسال فرمایید.   یادآور می شود مهلت پاسخ حداکثر تا 1400-07-19 است و دریافت نکردن پاسخ به منزله انصراف از داوری محسوب می شود.   لطفا آمادگی خود برای داوری مقاله را با کلیک روی گزینه های "قبول" یا "رد" اعلان فرمایید.   قبول: https://jonsat.nstri.ir/reviewer?_ad=4Oq2XYpMVmvqIp_Vt.58yLl6A8cw_2tHy9nlmdyqkfmNfC3VIAHoVSAtnE34X_iM   رد: https://jonsat.nstri.ir/reviewer?_ad=QWUzrFq3Z_k73zuoTZBlQIK6Q33Ux9_r0vqbgXdD3FAMH_iDjkp182ZZv_YX6fTW      برای دسترسی مستقیم به صفحه داوری مقاله روی این لینک کلیک کنید:   https://jonsat.nstri.ir/reviewer?_ad=Q9ARou90z1FRdrrFKT_Q9HOWR6u_RfHzzwiOOzbilFIXweLsXJF1Yx_6mQkKmLf5      توضیحات سردبیر / دبیر تخصصی:        با تشکر،   مجله علوم و فنون  هسته ای   سردبیر  مجله علوم  و  فنون هسته ای   مشخصات مقاله   عنوان: آنالیز اثرات انواع گردش طبیعی جریان بر میزان انتشار مواد رادیواکتیو در طی حادثه شدید نیروگاه PWR   چکیده: مکانیزم شکست ناشی از خزش در طی حادثه شدید یک راکتور subject:
Fw: [Junk released by Allowed List] on  Steam Generator Inspection
 Device and required services Technical proposal
full_text: Cc: ''jafari'' ; '''''derakhshandeh''''' ; email_26de59a8c4c6fb75' Subject: RE: [Junk released by Allowed List] on Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Technical proposalDear Mr. Dashti,We received your e-mail confirming the technical proposal, which is much appreciated. As a next step, we need to obtain a written approval from the IAEA for the scope of delivery including training and inspection, and then the official agent for this potential contract TT Luxenol will submit a commercial proposal. This is a prerequisite for our government to issue the export licence. I suggest that we put the efforts together in that process.Best regards,Zrinka-----Original Message-----From: email_5c503e5016c19dbd Sent: Thursday, September 9, 2021 10:27 PMTo: Zrinka Corak Cc: ''jafari'' ; '''''derakhshandeh''''' Subject: [Junk released by Allowed List] on Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Technical proposalDear Ms. Zrinka CorakAfter profound evaluation , we are  to inform you that The technical offer is confirmed.You are kindly requested to provide  Technical Commercial Proposal in final forms.The content of contract and Technical assignment will be drafted based on it and would be submitted for your agreement.Regards.H.G.Dashti----- متن اصلي -----From: zrinka corak To: email_5c503e5016c19dbdCc: email_a190cc98813c23dc, email_cb822c85c6540f1d, email_b521121dd2cb84ff, mohebi b فرستاده شد: Sun, 29 Aug 2021 18:55:02 +0430 (IRDT)عنوان: Fw: [Junk released by Allowed List]  consideration on  Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Technical proposalJust in case you have not received it from my inetec.hr e-mail.Kind regards, Zrinka     From: Zrinka CorakSent: Sunday, August 29, 2021 4:21 PMTo: email_fdb9c6c5ef236452' Cc: email_a190cc98813c23dc; email_cb822c85c6540f1d; email_b521121dd2cb84ff; email_8f2f145198993460Subject: RE: [Junk released by Allowed List] consideration on Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Technical proposal    Dear Mr. Dashti,    The revised proposal is enclosed. Please let me know if any additional information is needed.    Kind regards, Zrinka       From: email_5c503e5016c19dbd Sent: Monday, August 23, 2021 12:11 AMTo: Zrinka Corak Cc: email_a190cc98813c23dc;email_cb822c85c6540f1d; email_b521121dd2cb84ff; email_8f2f145198993460Subject: [Junk released by Allowed List] consideration on Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Technical proposal    Dear Ms. Zrinka Corak    First, I should apologize for the late respond due to  serious problem of my family. Unfortunately my dearest uncle passed away 3 days ago by COVID-19 and a lot of our relatives also in trouble with it, which is the biggest problem of our country now.    Thank you for profound respond. We all know about limitation and failure connected with welding plugs. All the effort performed to supply the reliable, safe, qualified and referenced Inspection and Plugging systems from your company. In order to obtain all required operational and design permission following would be beneficial to be indicated in the final Technical Commercial proposal which will be reflected in the contract:      - Previous licenses granted from Russian/Chinese/other countries’ regulatory authority to use inspection systems and mechanical plugs of INETEC.  - Previous Qualification Testing protocols from  Operating Organization for Inspection and plugging Modules.  - Reference explanatory note on reliability of INETEC plugging and inspection systems. 4.      The Qualification Testing condition of main inspection device should be provided. (included)-indicated in former letter 5.      The guarantee terms should include in technical offer. (included)- indicated in former letter 6.      After sale services and technical support services should be provided. (excluded)- indicated in former letter 7.      It would be necessary to obtain Iranian Regulatory Authority Licenses which will be facilitated if we have supportive documents mentioned in item 1, 2, 3. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. Faithfully yours H.G.Dashti             From: zrinka corak Sent: Thursday, August 19, 2021 1:18 AMTo: email_5c503e5016c19dbdCc: email_431ac3ca17833c15;email_cb822c85c6540f1d; email_2da35e4580091c1f; email_8f2f145198993460Subject: Fw: [Junk released by Allowed List] confirmation and consideration on Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Technical proposal    I am sending this email if you have not received the one that I sent from my business email address. Please see my email below.    Best regards, ZrinkaSent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone Begin forwarded message:On Wednesday, August 18, 2021, 10:38 PM, Zrinka Corak wrote: Dear Mr. H.G.Dashti,   We are aware of the fact that the application of welded plug is defined in the technical specification. Such Gidropress standpoint arose from the time when the mechanical plug technology was not accessible and available for Gidropress.   30 years ago INETEC initiated mechanical plug application, and it was agreed with Gidropress that we would have mutual approach on possibility of mechanical plug application. Consequently, the mechanical plug qualification was prepared based on which Gidropress approved the use of mechanical plug. On grounds of the approved qualification, a great number of VVER nuclear power plants across the world have implemented mechanical plug, such as Finland, Armenia, Bulgaria, Hungary, Ukraine, China-more than 27.000 mechanical plugs have been installed.    We are pleased to say that some of mechanical plugs was installed 30 years ago and we have never faced any issues. That is not the case with the welded plug.   We know that welded plug technology still exists on certain nuclear power plants, and we have information that significant issues have appeared which have led to leakage after their installation. Therefore, we are confident that the use of mechanical plug is the needed and the best solution. In a case of signing the contract, you will gain insight into the qualification of mechanical plug which is approved by Gidropress.   Please let me know if you additional information or explanation on this subject is needed.   Best regards, Zrinka       From: email_5c503e5016c19dbd Sent: Wednesday, August 18, 2021 5:28 PMTo: Zrinka Corak Cc: Dusko Corak ;email_a190cc98813c23dc; email_cb822c85c6540f1d; email_2da35e4580091c1f;email_8f2f145198993460Subject: [Junk released by Allowed List] confirmation and consideration on Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Technical proposal   Dear Ms. Zrinka Corak   In reply to your technical proposal submitted on 10 August 2021, based on evaluation performed on our plant and headquarter, the technical offer is confirmed as noted by considering following comments. 1.      The plant designer procedure indicate that plugs should be sealed by welds. Considering the fact that you provide long reference on mechanical tubes  in your correspondence and  are included in the offer, please provide technical reference note on non-necessity for plug welding which could be the basis for Technical Conclusion for acquiring Russian Chief Designer. In this regards, indication of the previous approval of VVER General Designer would be beneficial. (included) 2.      The plug welding module specification and qouatation would be suitable excluding from the current contract. (if any) (excluded) 3.      The Qualification Testing condition of main inspection device should be provided. (included) 4.      The guarantee terms should include in technical offer. (included) 5.      After sale services and technical support services should be provided. (excluded)   Your kind attention in this regard is highly appreciated.   Faithfully yours H.G.Dashti     Begin forwarded message: On Tuesday, August 10, 2021, 9:55 PM, Zrinka Corak wrote: Dear Mr. H.G. Dashti, Our proposal is enclosed. You may notice that the commercial part has not been completed. We suggest that once you confirm the scope of delivery, we submit to you the commercial part. If you need any additional information and/or explanation, please let me know. Kind regards, Zrinka Sent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone Begin forwarded message:On Saturday, August 7, 2021, 5:24 PM, email_5c503e5016c19dbd wrote: Dear Ms. Zrinka Corak subject: Reply Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services   in respond to the request of confirmation dated august 3, 2021 please notify followings: 1.    the term "A new SG inspection and plugging equipment including eddy current system, plugging system, plugs, training and inspection." is confirmed as noted by adding Ultrasonic Inspection module. please provide Technical Commercial Proposal (TCP). 2.    the term "A contaminated SG inspection and plugging equipment including eddy current system, plugging system, plugs, training and inspection" is confirmed as noted by adding Ultrasonic Inspection module. please provide TCP. 3.    the term "Your nuclear power plant is VVER-1000, therefore, we deem you do not need ultrasound inspection system." is not confirmed. the UT module is required for collector welds and ligament possible inspection. please include UT system to your TCP as it is indicated in RFP June 29, 2021. your kind action in this regard is highly appreciated.     Faithfully yours H.G.Dashti Equipment Supply Manager NPPD corporation Demail_d56c1955a6b05dfc, +phone_no_dd7a8474deeacbea11   از:"zrinka corak" به:email_5c503e5016c19dbd رونوشت:"jafari" , "WORK" فرستاده شد:سه شنبه 12 مرداد 1400,  8:53:36ب.ظعنوان:Fw: Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services   Dear Mr. H.G.Dashti,   I received the notification that the below e-mail failed to be delivered.  Therefore, I am resending the e-mail.   Kind regards, Zrinka       From: Zrinka CorakSent: Tuesday, August 3, 2021 2:58:54 PMTo: email_5c503e5016c19dbd; Dusko CorakCc: jafari; email_db59fbe8929eeb73Subject: RE: Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services    Dear Mr. H.G. Best regards, Zrinka Sent from Yahoo Mail for iPhone  Begin forwarded message: On Wednesday, August 18, 2021, 10:38 PM, Zrinka Corak < email_a0b64b0f477e0eec > wrote:  Dear Mr. H.G.Dashti,    We are aware of the fact that the application of welded plug is defined in the technical specification.  Such Gidropress standpoint arose from the time when the mechanical plug technology was not accessible and available for Gidropress.    30 years ago INETEC initiated mechanical plug application, and it was agreed with Gidropress that we would have mutual approach on possibility of mechanical plug application.  Consequently, the mechanical plug qualification was prepared based on which Gidropress approved the use of mechanical plug.  On grounds of the approved qualification, a great number of VVER nuclear power plants across the world have implemented mechanical plug, such as Finland, Armenia, Bulgaria, Hungary, Ukraine, China-more than 27.000 mechanical plugs have been installed.    We are pleased to say that some of mechanical plugs was installed 30 years ago and we have never faced any issues. That is not the case with the welded plug.  We know that welded plug technology still exists on certain nuclear power plants, and we have information that significant issues have appeared which have led to leakage after their installation.  Therefore, we are confident that the use of mechanical plug is the needed and the best solution.  In a case of signing the contract, you will gain insight into the qualification of mechanical plug which is approved by Gidropress.    Please let me know if you additional information or explanation on this subject is needed.    Best regards,  Zrinka        From: email_5c503e5016c19dbd < email_5c503e5016c19dbd > Sent: Wednesday, August 18, 2021 5:28 PM To: Zrinka Corak < email_a0b64b0f477e0eec > Cc: Dusko Corak < email_45df8616303da51d >; email_a190cc98813c23dc ; email_cb822c85c6540f1d ; email_2da35e4580091c1f ; email_8f2f145198993460 Subject: [Junk released by Allowed List] confirmation and consideration on Steam Generator Inspection Device and required services Technical proposal    Dear Ms. Zrinka Corak    In reply to your technical proposal submitted on 10 August 2021, based on evaluation performed on our plant and headquarter, the technical offer is confirmed as noted by considering following comments.  1.      The plant designer procedure indicate that plugs should be sealed by welds. Considering the fact that you provide long reference on mechanical tubes  in your correspondence and  are included in the offer, please provide technical reference note on non-necessity for plug welding which could be the basis for Technical Conclusion for acquiring Russian Chief Designer. In this regards, indication of the previous approval of VVER General Designer would be beneficial. (included)  2.      The plug welding module specification and qouatation would be suitable excluding from the current contract. (if any) (excluded)  3.      The Qualification Testing condition of main inspection device should be provided. (included)  4.      The guarantee terms should include in technical offer. (included)  5.      After sale services and technical support services should be provided. (excluded)    Your kind attention in this regard is highly appreciated. Detailed questions: 1. Was the sealing of the flange connectors of the emergency cooling heat exchangers (Drawing 08.8111.335) performed using soft gaskets made of paronite, TEG ( Thermally Expanded Graphite) or other sealing material, without welding the membrane seal? 2. If the answer to question No. 1 is positive: - Have there been any comments on the operation of such seals? - Has the sealing surfaces been modified, and how? - What sealing material was used? - Have the membranes on these connectors been replaced before? Your responses will be appreciated. Best regards, Afanaskin Iurii Уважаемые коллеги , Запорожская АЭС просит поделиться опытом уплотнения фланцевых разъемов теплообменников аварийного расхолаживания (чертеж 08.8111.335), с применением мягких прокладок. Конкретные вопросы в приложении к сообщению. Ваши ответы будут приняты с благодарностью. subject: PI I-WG: Chemistry Sub-committee Survey
full_text: WANO's mission is to maximise the safety and reliability of nuclear power plants worldwide by working together to assess, benchmark and improve performance through mutual support, exchange of information, and emulation of best practices.    Dear Ebrahim,  As you may already know, the Performance Indicator Industry Working Group (PI I-WG) is initiating two new sub-committees to address the issues that members are facing with both the Chemistry and Fuel Reliability performance indicators.  I am contacting you because you have been nominated to join the Chemistry indicator sub-committee.  We are looking to host the first virtual meeting for this sub-committee during the first week of November.  First, we would like to understand a little more about the specific issues that our members face with this indicator.  Please take a few minutes to complete this survey: https://forms.office.com/r/ees1C5SKBS  before Wednesday 27 October.  If you have any questions, I will be happy to answer them.  Best wishes, Sandor  Sandor Nagy  Projects Director  World Association of Nuclear Operators (WANO)  WANO London, Level 35, 25 Canada Square, London E14 5LQ, United Kingdom  Tel: +44 (0)20 3700 0780  email_5dc86b1e668addcf  WANO’s mission is to maximise the safety and reliability of nuclear power plants worldwide by working together to assess, benchmark and improve performance through mutual support, exchange of information, and emulation of best practices.

subject: اطلاع رسانی عمومی قوانین و مقررات (786)
full_text: مصوبات هیات وزیران ابلاغی 22 الی 27 تیرماه 1400 و...                                                                         تصویبنامه درخصوص تعیین شهرستان نهبندان استان خراسان جنوبی به مدت سه ماه به عنوان منطقه گرمسیر 4                                        تصویبنامه هیات وزیران درخصوص تعیین شهرستان نهبندان استان خراسان جنوبی به مدت سه ماه به عنوان منطقه گرمسیر 4 ابلاغ شد.                                    دریافت متن کامل                                             تصویبنامه درخصوص تسویه بدهی شرکت راه آهن جمهوری اسلامی ایران به شرکت ملی پالایش و پخش فرآورده های نفتی ایران                                        تصویبنامه هیات وزیران درخصوص تسویه بدهی شرکت راه آهن جمهوری اسلامی ایران به شرکت ملی پالایش و پخش فرآورده های نفتی ایران ابلاغ شد.                                    دریافت متن کامل                                             بخشنامه درخصوص اجرای دادنامه شماره 1757 مورخ 99/11/18 هیات عمومی دیوان عدالت اداری مبنی بر لغو بند 3 ماده 13 مصوبه شماره 1127128 شورای عالی اداری موضوع حقوق شهروندی در نظام اداری                                        بخشنامه سازمان اداری و استخدامی کشور درخصوص اجرای دادنامه شماره 1757 مورخ 99/11/18 هیات عمومی دیوان عدالت اداری مبنی بر
